programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six faces a threat to his sanity in the midst of a masked ball, where he meets Peter Pan and Little Bo Peep and finds himself being placed on trial for making an audacious bid to foil his captors. Cult drama, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: A desperate Trill takes the group hostage and confiscates the Dax symbiote, placing Jadzia's life in peril. Sci-fi adventure, starring Terry Farrell

programme.title: Ice Quake (2010)
programme.desc: A family's Christmas getaway on an Alaskan mountain is disrupted by a series of devastating ecological catastrophes, including earthquakes, avalanches and escaping natural gas that can freeze people solid. Disaster movie, starring Brendan Fehr and Holly Dignard

programme.title: Morlocks (2011)
programme.desc: A military experiment to create a time machine backfires, leaving a doorway open between the present and a horrific future. Monstrous creatures journey back in time to go on the rampage, and a group of soldiers is tasked with shutting down the gate before any more get through. Sci-fi horror, starring David Hewlett, Christina Cole and Robert Picardo

programme.title: Jules Verne's Rocket to the Moon (1967)
programme.desc: Legendary American showman Phineas T Barnum designs a space rocket, which he hopes will take him to the moon, but his scheme is threatened when two crooks get wind of his plan and decide to sabotage the craft. Sci-fi comedy, starring Terry-Thomas, Lionel Jeffries, Burl Ives, Gert Frobe, Dennis Price and Hermione Gingold

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Part one of two. Spock describes the Enterprise's long-ago mission to the forbidden planet of Talos IV while he is being court-martialled for hijacking the starship and kidnapping his former captain. Sci-fi drama, starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy and former Enterprise captain Jeffrey Hunter, who appears during flashback sequences

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: Cardassians arrive to reclaim an orphan raised by the Bajorans, provoking a violent confrontation aboard the station. Sci-fi adventure, guest starring Andrew Robinson, Vidal Peterson and Terrence Evans

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six wakes to find himself back in London, but his delight is cut short by the realisation that his mind has been transported into the body of a scientist wanted by the Village authorities. Vintage drama, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: The mysterious death of a prospector prompts Walker to go on the trail of a treasure hoard which has been missing for more than 100 years, and his search leads to a supernatural encounter with the spirit of a legendary ranger. Chuck Norris stars

programme.title: Paydirt (2020)
programme.desc: A man recently released from prison teams up with his old crew to find a buried bag of cash stolen a decade ago, while being tracked by a retired Sheriff. Crime thriller, starring Val Kilmer

programme.title: Exorcist: The Beginning (2004)
programme.desc: A Catholic priest joins an archaeological dig to unearth a 5th-century church buried beneath the plains of Kenya. However, as the excavation proceeds, strange occurrences begin to plague the camp - culminating in madness and bloodshed as an ancient evil force is unwittingly unleashed upon the world. Horror prequel, starring Stellan Skarsgard, Izabella Scorupco, James D'Arcy and Remy Sweeney

programme.title: Re-Animator (1985)
programme.desc: A medical student and his girlfriend are drawn into a series of bizarre experiments by his creepy new roommate, who has found a way to bring the dead back to life. However, his efforts lead to all manner of gory consequences for the unwitting heroes. Horror based on HP Lovecraft's short story, starring Jeffrey Combs, Bruce Abbott, Barbara Crampton and David Gale

programme.desc: In the near future, 10 death row convicts are forced to compete in a virtual reality game that pits them against dinosaurs and each other. Sci-fi thriller, starring Ryan Merriman, Perrey Reeves and Adam Hampton

programme.title: Quatermass and the Pit (1967)

Sci-fi horror based on the classic TV series, starring Andrew Keir, Barbara Shelley, James Donald and Julian Glover

programme.desc: Part two of two. On trial for hijacking the Enterprise to take it to the planet of Talos IV, Spock produces evidence to prove Captain Pike made contact with the Talosians. Sci-fi adventure, starring Leonard Nimoy

John Carpenter's sci-fi horror remake, starring Kurt Russell, Wilford Brimley, TK Carter, Keith David and Richard Dysart

Drama, guest starring George Cole, Roy Hudd and Jan Francis

The pathologist calls on Leo for help as he is forced to retreat underground while continuing to work on the case

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall

Later, at Tresillian House near Newquay, Rick meets with head gardener John Harris to find out more about his Victorian walled garden

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson invites TV presenter Steph McGovern on a journey around Northumberland. They search for ingredients for dinner with the help of a beach foraging expert, harness the wind to try their hands at kite buggying here they enjoy beach foraging, kite buggying and go looking for tiny wildlife on a bug safari

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young married couple seek to escape London's Docklands and move to the Chiltern Hills of Buckinghamshire. Guided by Ginny Buckley, and with a healthy budget of £850,000, they want to realise their dream of raising their family with more room inside and more green space outside. The property search happens to fall in the same week as the Henley Regatta, where Ginny gets behind the scenes with rowing royalty at this famous societal sporting event

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Leonard and Cristina's garden in Birmingham doesn't get much sun and has an awkward slope right in the middle. Designers Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill both think they have the answer - and go head to head to persuade the pair in invest their £3,000 budget in their respective visions of the ideal multi-functional family garden

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst's antique trail takes them to the Isle of Man, where Tim picks up a captain's chair, a pair of bears, a bronzed sculpture of a footballer, while Margie plays it safer with a bargain antique corkscrew, as well as a cocktail shaker and a sewing machine

programme.title: Pointless

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show

programme.title: EastEnders

Kim and Howie fall out over her plans to talk about mental health online. Freddie encourages a dejected Alfie to use the power of positive thinking

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring three treasured family heirlooms - and the memories they hold - back to life. Stephen Kember mends a cherished but sadly long mute music box. Bequeathed to Betty Hill by her beloved father, a professional stage magician, this miniature item presents an exacting undertaking for the restorer. A much-loved pushalong horse, and revive a water-damaged penny arcade game are also rejuvenated

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk visit 88-year-old Pattie. Widowed and forced to downsize, it's time to declutter and enjoy a holiday with the proceeds of the pop-up auction

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents the grand final, with judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young kicking things off by challenging the sewers to make a Victoriana-style evening dress. These dresses require delicate fabrics to create the glamorous effect, but they are tricky to handle. Next, it's the sewers' last chance to show off their instinct for design in the transformation challenge, as they attempt to turn female party wear into a glamorous men's red-carpet outfit. Finally, they fit a Met Gala-worthy 'two-in-one' dress for their models, who this week are a friend or family member

programme.title: BBC News at Ten

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Comedy about a young aspiring film-maker trapped in a recruitment job. When Kwabena bumps into an old friend from film school who is now working at a production company, he gets the chance that he has been waiting for. Unfortunately, she fixes him a once-in-a-lifetime pitching opportunity that clashes with a career-saving presentation - forcing him to choose between going all in or giving up his dream entirely. Co-written by and starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moonlights as a food delivery driver to finance his film, but feels his new job makes him beneath Vanessa, so he struggles to keep it a secret. Things start to look up when he is hired by Funmi to film her eccentric aunt's 60th birthday party, and gets an intriguing tip from an old film school friend. Amy pushes for a promotion at work, and Maurice is anxious about fatherhood. Guest starring Peter Serafinowicz and Jo Martin

programme.desc: USA v Netherlands (Kick-off 2.00am). All the action from the Group E encounter at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand, as both teams play their second match. This is a repeat of the 2019 final, which the Americans won 2-0 in France. Reshmin Chowdhury presents, with analysis from Anita Asante and Fern Williams, and commentary by Steve Wyeth and Fara Williams

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A road traffic collision leads to the conviction of a cold-blooded killer, a glamorous casino patron lets police crack an international money laundering scheme and a speeding motorbike prompts officers to arrest a prolific burglar

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle joins a naughty male tiger on a training regime, Kate Humble catches up with a hand-reared cheetah, and the park's staff go in search of British wildlife living freely on the estate

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy Walsh heads to in Rugeley, Staffordshire, to see a three-bed mid-terrace bought by a trio of experienced developers. Martin Roberts is in Cudham in the south-east London Borough of Bromley visiting a two-bed end-terrace cottage bought by a mother to help get her daughter on the property ladder. Jacqui Joseph is in north-west London to see two flats that may be better reverting back to one

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Hele near Exeter. Experts Danny Sebastian and John Cameron help their teams pick three items to take to auction in Honiton. Plus, Natasha discovers more about fossilist Mary Anning

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: At Golitha Falls, where the River Fowey tumbles down to the sea, Rick meets Dawn French, who has made Cornwall her home. In the shadow of Devonport Dockyard, he boards the world's busiest chain ferry to cross the wide River Tamar, the ancient watery boundary between Devon and Cornwall - along the way discovering an unusual event involving circus elephant. And he meets a man who thinks he has discovered the next superfood, which Rick used to cook up a delicious duck dish

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Sunderland-born actress Melanie Hill, formerly of Coronation Street, joins Robson on his pursuit of outdoor activities to help relax and recharge. They travel to one of the UK's biggest waterfalls, High Force

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in Derbyshire with a recently married couple who are making an epic location shift and swapping the Blue Mountains in Australia for the wilds of the Peak District. They have a significant budget of £750,000 and have their hearts set on a character home with a large garden for their three dogs. Away from his quest, Jules comes across an unlikely centre of manufacturing nestled in the county's rural countryside

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Gosport couple Nicola and David met on stage so they want the team to turn their unloved garden into the ultimate, theatrical showstopper. Can Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull give them a space to entertain their friends and perform some of their amateur dramatic favourites, while also providing a quiet haven for wildlife, for £6,000?

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst embark on the fourth leg of their jaunt in their camper van. They head to Blackpool, with items including a prancing leather horse and a nutcracker

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the usual mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey worries she has a stalker and when she receives flowers from her private client, she realises he knows where she lives. Alfie gets on the wrong side of his new boss on his first day, but manages to impress her by resolving a fight between Freddie and Patrick. Anna takes drastic steps to help Sharon and Linda repair their friendship

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey encourages members of the Patel family to tidy their immediate environment, as mum Bijal, dad Darshan and their two children move all their possessions into a warehouse, where they are encouraged to recycle, donate and sell items. There are emotional moments as the quartet go through their most treasured items. Bijal and Darshan struggle to part with their possessions, but really want to create an environment free of the chaos for their son, who finds it hard to concentrate in the clutter. As usual, home improvement gurus Dilly Carter, Iwan Carrington and Robert Bent offer tidying and upcycling tips

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Actress Lesley Manville researches her family tree. So far as her mother's side is concerned, by delving deep into Brighton's local archives, Lesley uncovers a complex story of wartime separation, adultery and the inaccessibility of divorce. Tracing back her father's line sees Lesley trying to solve what happened to her ancestor Aaron Harding. A widower with a large family to feed, Aaron protested poor conditions and pay as an agricultural worker in 1830 - a protest that would become known as the Swing Riots. He was arrested and subsequently transported to Australia

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Accountant (2016)
programme.desc: Autistic number-cruncher Christian Wolff moonlights as a money launderer for the Mob. However, the Treasury Department start closing in on him, so he decides to take on a legitimate client in the form of a robotics company. As he works through their books, he uncovers a discrepancy involving millions of dollars. Thriller action, starring Ben Affleck, Anna Kendrick and JK Simmons

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: England v Denmark (Kick-off 9.30am). All the action from both teams' second match in Group D, held at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. The sides last met in 2019, when England won a friendly 2-0 in Walsall, and the European champions will be hopeful of another victory this morning as they continue their bid to add this trophy to their collection. Alex Scott presents, with analysis from Steph Houghton and Rachel Brown-Finnis, and commentary by Robyn Cowen and Rachel Brown-Finnis

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles hosts from Southwell Racecourse in Nottinghamshire. Experts Gary Pe and David Harper help the reds and blues decide which three items to spend their £300 on that they hope will make a profit at the auction in Lincoln. Eric also pays a visit to the Lincoln Vintage Vehicle Society to learn about the old craft of coachbuilding.

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick heads into the county's china clay pits to discover what is known locally as white gold, one of its most important industries. He then climbs the Cornish Alps, huge slag heaps created by the clay mining and some of Cornwall's highest land. After a wild swim at one of Cornwall's picturesque hidden coves, Rick cooks a simple sea bass recipe, revealing how to make the perfect mayonnaise. In the far west of the county, on the Land's End peninsula, Rick meets his niece, a modern artist, who explains her deep spiritual connection to Cornwall

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by his Uncle Matheson to test a night in a local youth hostel. They sign up for a cookery class, take a guided walk on Hadrian's Wall and visit remote honey bee hives

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley meets a couple who are looking to return to their Welsh homeland after 20 years of living in Oxford. The pair have a budget of £450,000 to find the right home in Carmarthenshire with enough land to accommodate visiting friends and their pooches. Elsewhere, Ginny samples a regional delicacy at Britain's only manufacturer of pickled cockles

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull are challenged to turn a tired old garden into a space inspired by the Middle East. John and Vanessa want a garden reminiscent of Oman, the desert kingdom where they first met. The large raised planter right outside the back doors - nicknamed the sarcophagus - is outdated and dominates the garden, and John and Vanessa are desperate for it to go, but they are keen for the materials to be reused to make the most of their £4,000 budget

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Tim Medhurst and Margie Cooper shop for a final time, stuffed with celebratory Bakewell tarts. A bulldog gong and an old toy do battle at the final auction in Buckinghamshire

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Alex Jones round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Josh Quigley was pushed to the brink by alcohol. However, his life took a remarkable turn when he embarked on a transformative journey, cycling around the world. Now, fuelled by a second chance, he pushes himself to the limits in pursuit of a coveted spot in the World Championships. This documentary recounts a story of resilience and strength, where the power of never giving up offers a profound reason to live

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League striker Kevin Campbell, European champion sprinter Adam Gemili, Ashes-winning cricketer Ashley Giles and world 800m and 4x400m bronze medallist Jenny Meadows join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer Tom Allen, former Blue Peter presenter Sarah Greene, rugby star Ugo Monye and comedian Morgana Robinson join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy prepares a special meal so she and Lee can enjoy an evening in without distractions to discuss the state of their marriage. However, Lee becomes obsessed with a strange beeping noise in the house that he can't find - and the food is soon forgotten. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Comedy about a self-made man struggling to keep his head above water as the 1980s turn into the 1990s. Martin Parker has the ambition of Alan Sugar and the swagger of Robert Kilroy Silk. With a chain of electrical stores bearing his name, he seems to have it all. However the truth is he swimming in debt, his complicated private life is catching up with him and he's starting to lose his power. Written by and starring Sian Gibson, with Conleth Hill, Rosie Cavaliero, George Costigan, Sheila Reid and Jason Barnett

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Spider-Man: Far from Home (2019)
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Avengers' climactic battle for the fate of the universe, the teenage webslinger just wants life to get back to normal. A school trip across Europe seems just the thing - but he ends up recruited by spy agency SHIELD to battle an invasion by elemental monsters from another dimension. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Tom Holland, Jake Gyllenhaal, Zendaya and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Kirsty Wilson and Carole Baxter thin out the bamboo next to the pond and plant up a hanging basket full of herbs. Calum Clunie sends in the latest update from his allotment in Leven and George Anderson reveals a different way to propagate new plants. Plus, father-and-daughter gardeners Erin and Joe Armstrong work and garden together at their plot in East Lothian

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham presents this four-and-a-half-billion-year history of the planet, with each episode taking viewers on a journey through a pivotal moment when the Earth's future hung in the balance. The story begins with one of the darkest periods in the planet's history 252 million years ago - the worst mass extinction it has ever seen, when as much as 90 per cent of all species died

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Spain v Zambia (Kick-off 8.30am). All the action from both teams' second Group B match, which comes from Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. Spain reached the last 16 four years ago and will expect to take the points against the tournament debutantes. Reshmin Chowdhury presents, with analysis from Fara Williams and Anita Asante, and commentary by Vicki Sparks and Karen Bardsley

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Ruth Goodman heads to Polperro to get some tips for completing a complex fisherman's jumper and Tessa Dunlop takes the plunge into the glamorous history of British lidos

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair to answer questions on the specialist subjects of freshwater fish of the British Isles, Nick Cave, the history of scouting in the UK, and Lin-Manuel Miranda, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Central region chefs must cook their four-course menus again, though it remains to be seen whether they have successfully taken on board feedback from their earlier submissions. The duo need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton, broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, as well as guest judge singer-songwriters and UB40 member Ali Campbell

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes to sate cravings for a takeaway, including fish and chips from James Martin and a pizza recipe from Keith Floyd

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A fibre artist, a ceramicist and an abstract painter create artworks for a Staffordshire who woman wants a piece to mark the birth of her first grandchild. Nick Knowles presents

programme.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Focusing on the relationships between animals and people living in some of the world's most extraordinary natural wonders, this episode follows nomadic people from the Yamal Peninsula in northern Siberia, as they hunt one of the very few animals that can survive in this frozen environment, reindeer. Elsewhere, cameras observe a local ranger in the coastal salt marshes of Northern Australia's Arnhem Land, as he goes in search of the eggs of one of the world's most aggressive predators, the saltwater crocodile

programme.title: Great Alaskan Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey north on the Alaskan Railroad as he reaches to the quaint town of Talkeetna, where he helps fell a tree to clear land for a log cabin in a forest outside of town. From Talkeetna, Michael boards the Hurricane Turn, before arriving at the Denali National Park, crowned by the highest peak in the United States

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antiques expert Elizabeth Talbot discovers a valuable sculpture at Rochester Cathedral in Kent and Raj Bisram finds a ghostly Victorian photo album

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Sara Barron, Sanjeev Kohli, Josie Long and Gregg Wallace test their general knowledge skills, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: John, Lucy and Oliver take their shire horses to compete in Heckington Show in Lincolnshire

programme.title: The Secret Genius of Modern Life
programme.desc: With around a third of the population now owning fitness trackers, we've become a nation obsessed with tracking our every move. Hannah Fry finds out how 1970s car crashes helped us to count our steps, why high-altitude Second World War dog-fights led to a crucial health monitor, and how fitness trackers are even being used to catch killers

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul Murton travels from the shores of Loch Hope to the glorious and lonely expanse of Sandwood Bay in the far north-west of the country. Along the way he encounters a Pictish king and an ancient Broch, discovers wartime secrets in Loch Eriboll and a hidden monument to a naval disaster

programme.title: Dial M for Middlesbrough
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas and Sian Gibson return as Terry and Gemma from Draper's Tours, this time finding themselves forced to take refuge at a sinister and dilapidated caravan park after their coach breaks down. During the unplanned stay, visitors and residents begin to be bumped off one by one under grizzly circumstances. Black comedy, co-starring Sally Lindsay, Phil Davis, Joanna Page, Jason Donovan and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham tells the story of the event 800 million years ago when almost the entire planet froze and the chances of life surviving hung in the balance. Earth's journey into the deep freeze started with fire when the giant supercontinent Rodinia broke up and vast powerful tectonic forces ripped the land apart, kicking off a series of events that resulted in huge amounts of carbon dioxide being sucked from the atmosphere - sending global temperatures plummeting

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Will Foster and Lizzie Fraher offer up some designs to help Reena and Wes create more space in their three-bedroom 1960s terrace house in Borehamwood, which they've outgrown since moving in 12 years ago. With Wes often working from home, daughter Nyla's toys are competing for space with the desk and the kitchen doesn't have space for a table, so they eat all their meal on their knees in the living room. With family in Barbados and in the UK, Reena and Wes are desperate to create some space to get everyone together

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team visits busy mum Monique at her two-bedroom home in south east London. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, the team create special bunkbed spaces for her two daughters, address the overspill of toys with bespoke storage solutions, and give their bathroom a deep clean

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A con woman posing as a grieving widow fakes her husband's death, and a mechanic's dodgy £50,000 claim for a car jack injury is stopped in its tracks by investigators

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How a pharmacy took a stand against shoplifters by creating a 'wall of shame' and the introduction of an innovative bodycam able to help shopkeepers identify prolific shoplifters and abusive customers. Plus, the work of a vehicle forensics expert following a ram raid on a jewellers in Leeds. Presented by Rav Wilding

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops in Wolverhampton, where he finds out about the impact of Enoch Powell's 1968 speech. He also visits Kingsford Country Park on the outskirts of Kidderminster, investigates pigeon-racing in Worcester, and eventually looks into Cheltenham's jazz festival

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The team visits a three bed mid terrace property in Derby, a split level two bed flat in Southend on Sea, and a three bed mid terrace in Ebbw Vale, South Wales

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive goes off the tourist track in Rome, trying his hand at Italy's fastest growing sport, staying in the city's most unusual hotel and having a go at an ancient Roman art form

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures deep underground onto London's newest railway - the Elizabeth Line - enjoying a smooth ride from Paddington to Tottenham Court Road. Emerging into the sunshine in Bedford Square, Michael recalls the choking smogs which plagued the capital during the 1950s. He learns how smoke-free zones were introduced to tackle the problem and, high above the capital at the top of the BT Tower, discovers how the capital's air quality is monitored today

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Australia v Nigeria (Kick-off 11.00am). All the action from both teams' second match in Group B, held at Brisbane Stadium in Australia. The co-hosts will expect to reach the knockout stage for the fifth consecutive World Cup, while Nigeria also reached the last 16 four years ago. Alex Scott presents, with analysis from Steph Houghton and Rachel Brown-Finnis, and commentary by Jonathan Pearce and Gilly Flaherty

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of John Singer Sargent, The Sopranos, Jane Austen's novels, and Nick Drake, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two returnees and a newcomer make their way to the kitchen for the North West heats, preparing their starters and fish courses. The chefs begin by cooking their starters for a surprise veteran chef of the competition. Liam Simpson's dish takes inspiration from Liverpool's legendary Cream nightclub, while Adam Reid prepares a refined take on corned beef hash. For the fish course, Hrishikesh Desai creates a complex salmon curry

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: Kirsty Wilson creates four eco-friendly garden items all from recycled materials, including a fairy garden made out of broken terracotta pots and a terrarium out of a glass teapot

programme.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Documentary exploring some of the most inhospitable places on the planet concludes by shedding light on the lives of the Kamayura People, who reside in Brazil's Xingu Indigenous Park. For the Kamayura, pleasing the spirits is crucial to maintaining good health, and during one key festival, a warrior must dance for hours to appease a bird spirit, sustained only by food and drink brought to him by villagers. In Ethiopia, belief drives the residents of the Tigray region to climb a 400-metre mountain to reach their church. In Switzerland, the Zermatt air rescue team offers an insight into why millions of hikers, climbers and skiers visit the Swiss Alps every year, despite the risk of injury - or even death

programme.title: Great Alaskan Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches the end of the Alaskan Railroad as he finally arrives in Fairbanks, less than 200 miles from the Arctic Circle, where he meets scientists who study the Northern Lights. From Fairbanks, Michael travels to Juneau, where he researches the life of the remarkable author of his Appleton's, Eliza Scidmore

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: A special edition revisiting some of the historic venues from the series, with brand new valuations and unexpected auctions. Plus, Paul Martin uncovers the fascinating stories of the people of Berwick-upon-Tweed's Paxton House, past and present

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Sara Barron, Sanjeev Kohli, Josie Long and Gregg Wallace test their general knowledge skills, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Gussie and her mum Susan are a driving force on their family livestock farm in East Sussex, where three generations muck in every day to get the work done. Gussie's passion is her Welsh pigs and she's keen for her pedigree team to scoop up some recognition. Meanwhile, Kent farmer Hayley and dedicated daughter-in-law Amy round up the finest members of their flock, hoping they can rack up some rosettes for their Badger Face and Kerry Hill sheep. Gussie and Hayley compete in the judging ring for prize rosettes at Edenbridge & Oxted Agricultural Show. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day one of the Fifth Test in the Ashes series, which takes place at Kia Oval in London. The Aussies have already played a match here this summer in this format, defeating India by 209 runs in June to win the ICC World Test Championship

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef lifts the lid on the industry, revealing how it operates and meeting the skilled and passionate experts driving it forward. In this first episode, he explores the highly skilled and competitive world of fine dining. Tom chats to professionals who, like him, are obsessed with the pursuit of culinary excellence, including Lake District-based chef Ryan Blackburn

programme.title: David Harewood on Blackface
programme.desc: David Harewood investigates the roots of minstrelsy, a strange, intensely problematic, cultural form. It eventually paved the way for The Black and White Minstrel Show, which, at its peak, was watched by a Saturday night BBC TV audience of more than 20 million people. David looks at the effect the series had on his own career and that of fellow actors

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: Dee Dee ventures into the outside world and takes a day trip to Yoker. Jacqueline has a go at speed dating, while Limmy's decision to wear a cravat does not go down well at a karaoke bar. Elsewhere, a dance competition becomes worryingly intense, and viewers receive help with their spelling. Comedy, starring Brian Limond

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Mark Urban

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: A misunderstanding sends Nadine into an emotional state. Orna struggles to get Sean to be honest. Deep fissures in Brock and Kristi's relationship emerge

programme.title: His House (2020)
programme.desc: Having fled from war-torn South Sudan, refugees Bol and Rial Majur are finally free from detention and are given their own house. Struggling to adjust to their new life in an English town, they find that an evil force is lurking beneath the surface, with Rial believing that they have brought a night-witch with them on their journey from Africa. Horror thriller, starring Sope Dirisu and Wunmi Mosaku, with Matt Smith

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: The series pairing some of the UK's best artists with extraordinary subjects returns, with Bill Bailey hosting a run focusing on NHS workers. The first episode features sculptor Nick Elphick, whose work aims not just to replicate the human form, but to express a deeper meaning. His subject is trauma surgeon Martin, who treats two stabbings a day and two shootings a week, with most of his patients still children

programme.title: Why Sharks Attack
programme.desc: Following three shark attacks in two years just metres from a beach in the Red Sea vacation resort of Hurghada, Egypt, this documentary investigates the recent shift in shark behaviour and whether human activity and climate change could be the causes. Professor Gavin Naylor of the University of Florida looks back to the evolution of sharks for answers while Dr Dean Grubbs of Florida State University gets hands on, catching sharks to study and better understand their movements. Dr Laura Ryan, of Macquarie University, explains her research into a possible case of mistaken identity in which the sharks are mistaking humans for their preferred prey of seals.

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Whitby, where he explores the port's shipbuilding and seafaring heritage, to Robin Hood's Bay, a former smuggling haven

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire, Michael Portillo heads to the castle of Eastnor at the foot of the Malvern Hills. He also visits Coleford in the Forest of Dean, Slimbridge in Gloucestershire, and Bristol Temple Meads. From there he heads to Filton to investigate the centre of Britain's post-war aviation industry

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Epsom in Surrey, and hails a hackney cabs to take him across London. The Reds and the Blues are led by Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival, Arit Anderson, Toby Buckland and Adam Frost reveal the latest in floral fashions and share highlights of the show gardens and floral marquee. These include co-presenter Carol Klein's own creation, which has taken her three months to complete

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman catches up with the Langridge family three years on from their trial week in Perth, which was intended to decide if moving to Australia was right for them

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A suspicious police officer discovers a crooked solicitor is facilitating sham marriages for money, while a poaching complaint leads officers to a hidden drug's den and an international smuggler. Plus, a dodgy number plate sends officers on a high-speed pursuit and arrest of an armed criminal

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: It is the tiger cubs' first birthday bash, and Ben Fogle and Kate Humble look for signs that Longleat Safari Park's Southern Koala breeding programme - the only one in Europe - has resulted in a joey. Meanwhile, Jean Johansson joins keeper James to take a closer look at the anatomy of Gwen - a huge hairy tarantula

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin visits a pair of houses in Cheshire that share a back garden, Martel Maxwell is in a Tyne and Wear property with hardly any windows and Martin Roberts visits Rhondda

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Seventeen contenders start this edition of the quiz, but how many of them will survive to face the £10,000 Question? Hosted by Rick Edwards

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Lyndon B Johnson, A Song of Ice and Fire, seabirds, and children's TV, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The North West chefs serve up their music-themed mains and desserts, knowing that one of them will be eliminated from the competition at the end of this heat. Michelin-starred newcomer Hrishikesh Desai pushes himself to the limit with a complex multi-part venison dish, Liam Trotman is desperate to impress with spicy barbecued pork with wedges - a meal he used to enjoy while listening to music with his family - and proud Mancunian Adam Reid hopes his course, based around a deceptively simple chicken stew, will help secure him a place at the banquet

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North West region chefs must cook their four-course menus again, though it remains to be seen whether they have successfully taken on board feedback from their earlier submissions. The duo need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton, broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, as well as guest judge singer-songwriter Amy MacDonald

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Cameraman Charlie Hamilton James has been captivated by otters for the last 25 years and has filmed them more than anyone else. Now, through the eyes of three river orphaned otters, he sets out to reveal their survival secrets and exactly why he believes these creatures are so special

programme.title: Great Alaskan Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Traversing British Columbia, Michael Portillo arrives in Skagway by seaplane from railwayless Juneau. He then heads further north for Dyea and the Chilkoot trail, which the first gold prospectors hiked a century ago to the Klondike. Among them was author Jack London, whose stories of sled dogs captured the spirit of the gold rush. After continuing his journey by rail along Lake Bennett to Carcross, Michael explores the art of the First Nations and helps to carve a totem pole. Then he's invited to shake his tail feathers in a 'grouse' dance

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: James Lewis and Jonathan Pratt are in Glemham Hall in Suffolk, where they uncover a 17th-century apothecary jar, while Paul Martin learns about a medieval port lost to the sea

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former champions Sara Barron, Sanjeev Kohli, Josie Long and Gregg Wallace face their final quizzes and the week's winner is crowned. Hosted by Richard Osman

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Diana and Nigel love their shire horses and emotions run high during judging at Melplash Show. Barry and Jess set their sights on victory with their Suffolk sheep

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day two of the Fifth Test in the Ashes series, which takes place at Kia Oval in London. The last meeting between the sides here in this format saw England prevail by 135 runs in 2019, ensuring the series ended in a 2-2 draw

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don harvests his potatoes and sows seeds for autumn vegetables. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings. Adam Frost meets a couple who have spent decades creating a garden on the exposed chalk hills of the Yorkshire Wolds and Sue Kent refreshes her garden to extend the colour and interest into late summer and autumn. Gardeners working in an extraordinary location on the edge of cliffs in Penzance reveal the wind-swept challenges they face and viewers meet a Sussex gardener who has taken the idea of outdoor living to a whole new level

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: Documentary examining the life of the iconic actress. In part one, aspiring star Norma Jeane attends an audition at 20th Century Fox, where the head of casting suggests she change her name to Marilyn Monroe. After connecting with Joseph Schenck, Marilyn is able to get a job at Columbia Pictures, where she receives her first starring role. Narrated by Jessica Chastain

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: Marilyn's rise is nearly ruined when news breaks that she posed nude for a calendar earlier in her career. She uses this to her advantage to showcase her body confidence. Monroe also demonstrates her unique talent for comedy in Gentlemen Prefer Blondes, and reaches superstar status

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Mark Urban

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef lifts the lid on the industry, revealing how it operates and meeting the skilled and passionate experts driving it forward. In this first episode, he explores the highly skilled and competitive world of fine dining. Tom chats to professionals who, like him, are obsessed with the pursuit of culinary excellence, including Lake District-based chef Ryan Blackburn

programme.title: David Harewood on Blackface
programme.desc: David Harewood investigates the roots of minstrelsy, a strange, intensely problematic, cultural form. It eventually paved the way for The Black and White Minstrel Show, which, at its peak, was watched by a Saturday night BBC TV audience of more than 20 million people. David looks at the effect the series had on his own career and that of fellow actors

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: The Wrights are in Scotland, starting out in the Cairngorns National Park, where Josh chooses to go bungee jumping - knowing full well that brother Mark has a fear of heights. Next up is a ride through the countryside on Segway scooters, but the brothers' rivalry comes to the fore once more and it turns into an insane race. Things become a little more relaxed when they spend the night in an idyllic cabin on the shores of Loch Lomond, followed by a fishing trip. But will any of them make a catch?

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Four new couples begin sessions with Dr Orna Guralnik, with Brock and Kristi unpacking their Mormon upbringing as they search for a new foundation, while Josh struggles with Natasha's lack of intimacy

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Christine's childhood PTSD surfaces, Josh's sexual frustration boils over, Erica reveals her resentment of Sean, and Brock struggles to lay bare Kristi's betrayal

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his Scottish railway journey from Dunbar to Peterhead in the beautiful medieval city of Stirling. At a towering monument overlooking the River Forth, Michael hears how, in 1297, William Wallace inflicted a shocking defeat on the English army at Stirling Bridge. Travelling across country to the River Tay, Michael discovers the city of Perth, before heading to the banks of the Tay for a magical sunset canoe trip to spot beavers

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Biologist Ben Garrod examines the evolution of skin - the largest organ in any creature's body - across all species of the animal kingdom, beginning by looking at how that of vertebrates has allowed them to conquer the planet.

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: A glimpse at the rarely seen South American wilderness, home to a range of creatures from terrain as varied as the Andes to Cape Horn. Cameras reveal the secret lives of pumas and hummingbirds, soar with condors over glacial peaks and explore monkey puzzle forests dating back to the time of the dinosaurs. The extreme kayakers who gain thrills and excitement from traversing the area's raging waterfalls are observed, as are the native cowboys, known as gauchos, as they round up wild horses. Narrated by Santiago Cabrera

programme.title: Immortal Egypt with Joann Fletcher
programme.desc: Joann explores the peak of ancient Egyptian civilisation by looking at the Colossi of Memnon, two massive stone statues depicting Pharaoh Amenhotep III, and examining the lives of the workers and artisans involved in the building of the Valley of the Kings. This golden age was threatened by the growing power of Karnak's priests, and Joann reveals how Tutankhamen's early death was a chance for Egypt to start afresh and rewrite history, but was undermined by decades of state-sanctioned looting of the tombs

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob's seminal documentary following the musician across America on his 1974 Diamond Dogs tour, at a time when his rock star excesses were at their most extreme. Originally shown as part of Omnibus in 1975, the film features revealing footage of Bowie and his fans, illustrating the effects of fame on musicians and their followers

programme.title: Zoe Wanamaker Remembers - Bowie and Baal
programme.desc: The actress looks back at the 1982 TV adaptation of Bertolt Brecht's play, in which she appeared alongside David Bowie in the title role

programme.title: Baal with David Bowie
programme.desc: David Bowie stars in this 1982 adaptation of Bertolt Brecht's first play. Set in pre-First World War Germany, it depicts scenes from the life of an amoral poet and singer during ruthlessly devoted to his own talent. He loves nature and the universe with a passion, but is coldly indifferent to all ordinary human feeling. Adapted by John Willett, and featuring appearances by Robert Austin, Jonathan Kent, Julian Wadham, Zoe Wanamaker and Polly James

programme.title: Westwood: Punk - Icon - Activist
programme.desc: Documentary film reflecting on the extraordinary career of fashion designer Vivienne Westwood, looking closely at her artistry, her activism and her cultural significance. Featuring contributions from Westwood herself, as well as Pamela Anderson, Christina Hendricks and Kate Moss

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his Scottish railway journey from Dunbar to Peterhead in the beautiful medieval city of Stirling. At a towering monument overlooking the River Forth, Michael hears how, in 1297, William Wallace inflicted a shocking defeat on the English army at Stirling Bridge. Travelling across country to the River Tay, Michael discovers the city of Perth, before heading to the banks of the Tay for a magical sunset canoe trip to spot beavers

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Biologist Ben Garrod examines the evolution of skin - the largest organ in any creature's body - across all species of the animal kingdom, beginning by looking at how that of vertebrates has allowed them to conquer the planet.

programme.title: Immortal Egypt with Joann Fletcher
programme.desc: Joann explores the peak of ancient Egyptian civilisation by looking at the Colossi of Memnon, two massive stone statues depicting Pharaoh Amenhotep III, and examining the lives of the workers and artisans involved in the building of the Valley of the Kings. This golden age was threatened by the growing power of Karnak's priests, and Joann reveals how Tutankhamen's early death was a chance for Egypt to start afresh and rewrite history, but was undermined by decades of state-sanctioned looting of the tombs

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Leuchars, known nowadays on the railways as Leuchars for St Andrews, which is Scotland's oldest university and is located on a beautiful beachfront

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Ben Garrod explores how skin has evolved to enable animals to move in a range of habitats, revealing how adaptations allow birds to fly, sharks to speed through water and sugar gliders to take to the air

programme.title: Shipwrecks: Britain's Sunken History
programme.desc: Maritime historian Dr Sam Willis travels to Africa to trace the origins and development of the women and children first protocol when abandoning ship - a code of conduct that came about in the Victorian era. He also reveals how the period oversaw trials of several other proposed solutions to high mortality rates at sea, such as life jackets, lifeboats, and rockets that could fire rescue lines on board stricken vessels

programme.title: Braveheart (1995)
programme.desc: Account of the life of medieval Scottish hero William Wallace. After the slaughter of his father and brother, young Wallace is taken in by his uncle, who teaches him how to use not only his brawn but his brain - which he employs to great effect years later when he resolves to drive the English out of Scotland. Oscar-winning historical epic, directed by and starring Mel Gibson. With Patrick McGoohan, Sophie Marceau and Catherine McCormack

programme.title: Murder on the Victorian Railway
programme.desc: Drama-documentary examining the death of banker Thomas Briggs in July 1864, which was the first murder to be committed on a British train. The film uses testimonies from court transcripts, memoirs, letters and newspaper reports to tell the story of the crime through those connected to it, including engine driver Alfred Ekin - who found the body - and Richard Tanner, the detective in charge of the investigation. It also explores the huge public outcry and debate it provoked. Narrated by Toby Jones

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Leuchars, known nowadays on the railways as Leuchars for St Andrews, which is Scotland's oldest university and is located on a beautiful beachfront

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Gary Davies and Dixie Peach present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 25 July 1985. Featuring Arrow, Madonna, Feargal Sharkey, the Cure, the Pointer Sisters, Dire Straits, Trans-X and Eurythmics

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Noel Edmonds looks at the weekly pop chart from 1977 and introduces music by the Steve Gibbons Band, the Detroit Emeralds, Boney M, Showaddywaddy, Jonathan Richman and the Modern Lovers, Bob Marley and the Wailers, Dana, Emerson Lake and Palmer, Rita Coolidge, Thin Lizzy and Donna Summer

programme.title: Bollywood at the Proms
programme.desc: A musical tribute to the late Lata Mangeshkar, the Indian playback singer whose voice defined the sound of Bollywood for a generation of cinema-goers. Superstar singers Palak and Palash Muchhal, Indian classical musicians and Bollywood dancers join forces with the City of Birmingham Symphony Orchestra in a glorious musical fusion that commemorates more than five decades of Lata's stellar career. On a night when the Royal Albert Hall takes on the spirit of Mumbai, presenter Nikki Bedi and special guests honour her impact across generations, cultures and continents

programme.title: David Bowie at the BBC
programme.desc: The singer's concert at the BBC Radio Theatre, featuring performances of hits including Wild Is the Wind, Ashes to Ashes, Absolute Beginners, The Man Who Sold the World and Fame. First broadcast in 2000

programme.title: Radio 2 Live in Hyde Park
programme.desc: The duo's headline set at the Radio 2 festival in 2019, featuring performances of Always On My Mind, It's a Sin, Suburbia, Left to My Own Devices and West End Girls, Go West and Domino Dancing. There are also appearances from Olly Alexander on Dreamland and Beverley Knight for What Have I Done to Deserve This?

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Lola's family are from Spain, a country in southern Europe. She is making a traditional Spanish dish called empanadas for her and her friends. Lola begins by rolling out two pieces of pizza dough into big circles. She cooks one in the oven. Lola adds tomato puree to passata to make the filling. She also adds some canned tuna, green olives, and boiled egg. She seasons the mixture with paprika, black pepper and her special ingredient, oregano. Then Lola spreads the filling over the dough, which has been in the oven. She finishes the recipe by adding the last piece of dough on top and then putting it back in the oven to cook. Will Lola's friends find the empanadas tasty? Will they guess her special ingredient? There's a very exciting Spanish surprise waiting for her friends while they enjoy their meal!

programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: Fred and Pete are walking across some moorland close to one of Cornwall’s many ancient stone circles, when they come across a mysterious blob of metal. But what is it? After many failed guesses, they decide to take the metal blob to the museum. Suzy and Archie recognise that the metal blob is made of bronze, an important metal in early Cornish history. Thousands of years ago, bronze was used to make tools all over the county during a period called the Bronze Age. They meet archaeologist James, who explains how the discovery of bronze allowed people to make tools that were stronger and faster than the stone tools used before. Suzy rings them on the Treasure Comm to tell them how Bronze Age people used to live in what are called round houses. She sends them to one nearby to find out exactly what life was like back then. After changing into some Bronze Age clothing, Fred and Pete check out the round house and discover that Bronze Age people were kept very busy with simple, everyday tasks

programme.desc: Part one of two. In 1979, four holiday homes in Wales were torched in one night. This marked the beginning of an arson campaign targeting second homes owned by English people, whom the attackers claimed were destroying Welsh culture because of their part-time presence. Over the next decade, more than 200 homes and businesses were attacked by a secret organisation known as Meibion Glyndwr

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moonlights as a food delivery driver to finance his film, but feels his new job makes him beneath Vanessa, so he struggles to keep it a secret. Things start to look up when he is hired by Funmi to film her eccentric aunt's 60th birthday party, and gets an intriguing tip from an old film school friend.
