programme.desc: Tommy Walsh heads to in Rugeley, Staffordshire, to see a three-bed mid-terrace bought by a trio of experienced developers. Martin Roberts is in Cudham in the south-east London Borough of Bromley visiting a two-bed end-terrace cottage bought by a mother to help get her daughter on the property ladder. Jacqui Joseph is in north-west London to see two flats that may be better reverting back to one

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Hele near Exeter. Experts Danny Sebastian and John Cameron help their teams pick three items to take to auction in Honiton. Plus, Natasha discovers more about fossilist Mary Anning

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: At Golitha Falls, where the River Fowey tumbles down to the sea, Rick meets Dawn French, who has made Cornwall her home. In the shadow of Devonport Dockyard, he boards the world's busiest chain ferry to cross the wide River Tamar, the ancient watery boundary between Devon and Cornwall - along the way discovering an unusual event involving circus elephant. And he meets a man who thinks he has discovered the next superfood, which Rick used to cook up a delicious duck dish

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Sunderland-born actress Melanie Hill, formerly of Coronation Street, joins Robson on his pursuit of outdoor activities to help relax and recharge. They travel to one of the UK's biggest waterfalls, High Force

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in Derbyshire with a recently married couple who are making an epic location shift and swapping the Blue Mountains in Australia for the wilds of the Peak District. They have a significant budget of £750,000 and have their hearts set on a character home with a large garden for their three dogs. Away from his quest, Jules comes across an unlikely centre of manufacturing nestled in the county's rural countryside

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Gosport couple Nicola and David met on stage so they want the team to turn their unloved garden into the ultimate, theatrical showstopper. Can Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull give them a space to entertain their friends and perform some of their amateur dramatic favourites, while also providing a quiet haven for wildlife, for £6,000?

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst embark on the fourth leg of their jaunt in their camper van. They head to Blackpool, with items including a prancing leather horse and a nutcracker

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the usual mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey worries she has a stalker and when she receives flowers from her private client, she realises he knows where she lives. Alfie gets on the wrong side of his new boss on his first day, but manages to impress her by resolving a fight between Freddie and Patrick. Anna takes drastic steps to help Sharon and Linda repair their friendship

programme.title: Kiri's TV Flashback
programme.desc: Comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean rewinds through the BBC archive to unearth the most entertaining moments in TV, with a look at iconic Welsh people, places and things

programme.title: Iolo's Anglesey
programme.desc: Anglesey, Wales' largest island, is renowned for its coastal beauty, and on the sand dunes, rocky cliffs and surrounding farmland there's also spectacular wildlife. Iolo Williams finds colourful day-flying moths, beautiful orchids and brown hares. He also heads out to the Skerries Islands and visits Wales' only Arctic tern colony. Near an abandoned farm outside Holyhead, he also finds a fox and a little owl with its chick

programme.title: Firebombers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The second part of this documentary focuses on 1986, when the arson group had ramped up their attacks taking the firebombing campaign over the border into England. Margaret Thatcher's government enlisted the help of MI5 to catch those responsible

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Actress Lesley Manville researches her family tree. So far as her mother's side is concerned, by delving deep into Brighton's local archives, Lesley uncovers a complex story of wartime separation, adultery and the inaccessibility of divorce. Tracing back her father's line sees Lesley trying to solve what happened to her ancestor Aaron Harding. A widower with a large family to feed, Aaron protested poor conditions and pay as an agricultural worker in 1830 - a protest that would become known as the Swing Riots. He was arrested and subsequently transported to Australia

programme.title: The Accountant (2016)
programme.desc: Autistic number-cruncher Christian Wolff moonlights as a money launderer for the Mob. However, the Treasury Department start closing in on him, so he decides to take on a legitimate client in the form of a robotics company. As he works through their books, he uncovers a discrepancy involving millions of dollars. Thriller action, starring Ben Affleck, Anna Kendrick and JK Simmons

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: England v Denmark (Kick-off 9.30am). All the action from both teams' second match in Group D, held at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. The sides last met in 2019, when England won a friendly 2-0 in Walsall, and the European champions will be hopeful of another victory this morning as they continue their bid to add this trophy to their collection. Alex Scott presents, with analysis from Steph Houghton and Rachel Brown-Finnis, and commentary by Robyn Cowen and Rachel Brown-Finnis

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles hosts from Southwell Racecourse in Nottinghamshire. Experts Gary Pe and David Harper help the reds and blues decide which three items to spend their £300 on that they hope will make a profit at the auction in Lincoln. Eric also pays a visit to the Lincoln Vintage Vehicle Society to learn about the old craft of coachbuilding.

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick heads into the county's china clay pits to discover what is known locally as white gold, one of its most important industries. He then climbs the Cornish Alps, huge slag heaps created by the clay mining and some of Cornwall's highest land. After a wild swim at one of Cornwall's picturesque hidden coves, Rick cooks a simple sea bass recipe, revealing how to make the perfect mayonnaise. In the far west of the county, on the Land's End peninsula, Rick meets his niece, a modern artist, who explains her deep spiritual connection to Cornwall

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by his Uncle Matheson to test a night in a local youth hostel. They sign up for a cookery class, take a guided walk on Hadrian's Wall and visit remote honey bee hives

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley meets a couple who are looking to return to their Welsh homeland after 20 years of living in Oxford. The pair have a budget of £450,000 to find the right home in Carmarthenshire with enough land to accommodate visiting friends and their pooches. Elsewhere, Ginny samples a regional delicacy at Britain's only manufacturer of pickled cockles

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull are challenged to turn a tired old garden into a space inspired by the Middle East. John and Vanessa want a garden reminiscent of Oman, the desert kingdom where they first met. The large raised planter right outside the back doors - nicknamed the sarcophagus - is outdated and dominates the garden, and John and Vanessa are desperate for it to go, but they are keen for the materials to be reused to make the most of their £4,000 budget

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Tim Medhurst and Margie Cooper shop for a final time, stuffed with celebratory Bakewell tarts. A bulldog gong and an old toy do battle at the final auction in Buckinghamshire

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Alex Jones round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Royal Welsh Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the event that celebrates all the best that rural Wales has to offer

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League striker Kevin Campbell, European champion sprinter Adam Gemili, Ashes-winning cricketer Ashley Giles and world 800m and 4x400m bronze medallist Jenny Meadows join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Josh Quigley was pushed to the brink by alcohol. However, his life took a remarkable turn when he embarked on a transformative journey, cycling around the world. Now, fuelled by a second chance, he pushes himself to the limits in pursuit of a coveted spot in the World Championships. This documentary recounts a story of resilience and strength, where the power of never giving up offers a profound reason to live

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy prepares a special meal so she and Lee can enjoy an evening in without distractions to discuss the state of their marriage. However, Lee becomes obsessed with a strange beeping noise in the house that he can't find - and the food is soon forgotten. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Comedy about a self-made man struggling to keep his head above water as the 1980s turn into the 1990s. Martin Parker has the ambition of Alan Sugar and the swagger of Robert Kilroy Silk. With a chain of electrical stores bearing his name, he seems to have it all. However the truth is he swimming in debt, his complicated private life is catching up with him and he's starting to lose his power. Written by and starring Sian Gibson, with Conleth Hill, Rosie Cavaliero, George Costigan, Sheila Reid and Jason Barnett

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rewind: 60 Years of Welsh Pop
programme.desc: From the early days of the 1990s, Welsh musicians were at the forefront of the rejuvenated dance movement, producing floor fillers that are now considered classics - from house to techno to Drum & Bass. Artists featured in this retrospective include K-Klass, High Contrast, Nomad and Kosheen

programme.title: Spider-Man: Far from Home (2019)
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Avengers' climactic battle for the fate of the universe, the teenage webslinger just wants life to get back to normal. A school trip across Europe seems just the thing - but he ends up recruited by spy agency SHIELD to battle an invasion by elemental monsters from another dimension. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Tom Holland, Jake Gyllenhaal, Zendaya and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: The simple stop and search of a suspicious man leads to the arrest of a serial killer and a police officer's instinct leads to an armed stand-off in an isolated beauty spot. Plus, a road traffic collision leads to the discovery of a massive fraud with thousands of victims

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets a young zebra in crisis, Ben Fogle plays Sherlock Holmes to find escaped porcupines, and Jean Johansson learns what happens when a lion comes face to face with itself

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and a four-legged friend visit a semi-detached house in Swansea, and Martel Maxwell explores a terrace in Bishop Auckland, Co Durham. Plus, news on a plot of land in Bolton, Lancashire, first featured in 2019

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Detling, and challenges people to guess what an unusual gadget is for. Thomas Forrester and Ochuko Ojiri assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: On the wild north Atlantic coast, Rick heads out to sea to go fishing for lobsters with his old friend and celebrity chef Nathan Outlaw, before helping to cook up a lobster risotto. Later, at Tresillian House near Newquay, Rick meets with head gardener John Harris to find out more about his Victorian walled garden

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson invites TV presenter Steph McGovern on a journey around Northumberland. They search for ingredients for dinner with the help of a beach foraging expert, harness the wind to try their hands at kite buggying here they enjoy beach foraging, kite buggying and go looking for tiny wildlife on a bug safari

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young married couple seek to escape London's Docklands and move to the Chiltern Hills of Buckinghamshire. Guided by Ginny Buckley, and with a healthy budget of £850,000, they want to realise their dream of raising their family with more room inside and more green space outside. The property search happens to fall in the same week as the Henley Regatta, where Ginny gets behind the scenes with rowing royalty at this famous societal sporting event

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Leonard and Cristina's garden in Birmingham doesn't get much sun and has an awkward slope right in the middle. Designers Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill both think they have the answer - and go head to head to persuade the pair in invest their £3,000 budget in their respective visions of the ideal multi-functional family garden

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst's antique trail takes them to the Isle of Man, where Tim picks up a captain's chair, a pair of bears, a bronzed sculpture of a footballer, while Margie plays it safer with a bargain antique corkscrew, as well as a cocktail shaker and a sewing machine

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey decides to tell Martin what happens during her secret cam dates so he fully understands, but Theo overhears and is angry that they presume he must be a sad, old man. Kim and Howie fall out over her plans to talk about mental health online. Freddie encourages a dejected Alfie to use the power of positive thinking

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring three treasured family heirlooms - and the memories they hold - back to life. Stephen Kember mends a cherished but sadly long mute music box. Bequeathed to Betty Hill by her beloved father, a professional stage magician, this miniature item presents an exacting undertaking for the restorer. A much-loved pushalong horse, and revive a water-damaged penny arcade game are also rejuvenated

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk visit 88-year-old Pattie. Widowed and forced to downsize, it's time to declutter and enjoy a holiday with the proceeds of the pop-up auction

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents the grand final, with judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young kicking things off by challenging the sewers to make a Victoriana-style evening dress. These dresses require delicate fabrics to create the glamorous effect, but they are tricky to handle. Next, it's the sewers' last chance to show off their instinct for design in the transformation challenge, as they attempt to turn female party wear into a glamorous men's red-carpet outfit. Finally, they fit a Met Gala-worthy 'two-in-one' dress for their models, who this week are a friend or family member

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Comedy about a young aspiring film-maker trapped in a recruitment job. When Kwabena bumps into an old friend from film school who is now working at a production company, he gets the chance that he has been waiting for. Unfortunately, she fixes him a once-in-a-lifetime pitching opportunity that clashes with a career-saving presentation - forcing him to choose between going all in or giving up his dream entirely. Co-written by and starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moonlights as a food delivery driver to finance his film, but feels his new job makes him beneath Vanessa, so he struggles to keep it a secret. Things start to look up when he is hired by Funmi to film her eccentric aunt's 60th birthday party, and gets an intriguing tip from an old film school friend. Amy pushes for a promotion at work, and Maurice is anxious about fatherhood. Guest starring Peter Serafinowicz and Jo Martin

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Footballer Troy Deeney, heavyweight boxer Joe Joyce, mixed martial arts star Tom Aspinall, and World Champion swimmer Hannah Miley join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: USA v Netherlands (Kick-off 2.00am). All the action from the Group E encounter at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand, as both teams play their second match. This is a repeat of the 2019 final, which the Americans won 2-0 in France. Reshmin Chowdhury presents, with analysis from Anita Asante and Fern Williams, and commentary by Steve Wyeth and Fara Williams

There are emotional moments as the quartet go through their most treasured items. Bijal and Darshan struggle to part with their possessions, but really want to create an environment free of the chaos for their son, who finds it hard to concentrate in the clutter. programme.desc: Martin Roberts and a four-legged friend visit a semi-detached house in Swansea, and Martel Maxwell explores a terrace in Bishop Auckland, Co Durham. Plus, news on a plot of land in Bolton, Lancashire, first featured in 2019

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Detling, and challenges people to guess what an unusual gadget is for. Thomas Forrester and Ochuko Ojiri assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: On the wild north Atlantic coast, Rick heads out to sea to go fishing for lobsters with his old friend and celebrity chef Nathan Outlaw, before helping to cook up a lobster risotto. Later, at Tresillian House near Newquay, Rick meets with head gardener John Harris to find out more about his Victorian walled garden

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson invites TV presenter Steph McGovern on a journey around Northumberland. They search for ingredients for dinner with the help of a beach foraging expert, harness the wind to try their hands at kite buggying here they enjoy beach foraging, kite buggying and go looking for tiny wildlife on a bug safari

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young married couple seek to escape London's Docklands and move to the Chiltern Hills of Buckinghamshire. Guided by Ginny Buckley, and with a healthy budget of £850,000, they want to realise their dream of raising their family with more room inside and more green space outside. The property search happens to fall in the same week as the Henley Regatta, where Ginny gets behind the scenes with rowing royalty at this famous societal sporting event

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Leonard and Cristina's garden in Birmingham doesn't get much sun and has an awkward slope right in the middle. Designers Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill both think they have the answer - and go head to head to persuade the pair in invest their £3,000 budget in their respective visions of the ideal multi-functional family garden

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst's antique trail takes them to the Isle of Man, where Tim picks up a captain's chair, a pair of bears, a bronzed sculpture of a footballer, while Margie plays it safer with a bargain antique corkscrew, as well as a cocktail shaker and a sewing machine

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey decides to tell Martin what happens during her secret cam dates so he fully understands, but Theo overhears and is angry that they presume he must be a sad, old man. Kim and Howie fall out over her plans to talk about mental health online. Freddie encourages a dejected Alfie to use the power of positive thinking

programme.title: Barra's Return of the Wild
programme.desc: Barra Best hears from the passionate individuals helping species and environments under threat. He meets the team investigating the promising possibility a slippery substance found in plentiful supply around the country's coast could help reduce the methane output of cows - a major agricultural source of greenhouse gases. Plus, a deep dive below the surface of a German lake to view the spectacular natural miracle being aided by a group of volunteers and how the moose's turn as an unlikely Swedish reality TV star is helping shine a light on the species' plight

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Painter Jemisha Maadhavji creates artwork of junior doctor Grace, who sustained a life-altering spinal cord injury during her studies when a man jumped from a third-floor balcony and landed on her. She discusses how using a wheelchair can be an advantage in her work in a busy London A&E department, as it places her at eye level to patients in their beds, allowing her to better connect with them

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents the grand final, with judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young kicking things off by challenging the sewers to make a Victoriana-style evening dress. These dresses require delicate fabrics to create the glamorous effect, but they are tricky to handle. Next, it's the sewers' last chance to show off their instinct for design in the transformation challenge, as they attempt to turn female party wear into a glamorous men's red-carpet outfit. Finally, they fit a Met Gala-worthy 'two-in-one' dress for their models, who this week are a friend or family member

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ulster By the Sea
programme.desc: Further tales from the world of caravanners and caravanning across Northern Ireland, including Jim, who has been heading to Millisle every summer since he was a young child, and a group of teenagers who get to enjoy carefree days at the caravan that are hard to find at home in Belfast. Terry and Linda are a retired couple with a caravan in Ballycastle at one of the country's newest caravan parks and, with their working lives behind them, they give thanks for being able to do exactly as they please there

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Comedy about a young aspiring film-maker trapped in a recruitment job. When Kwabena bumps into an old friend from film school who is now working at a production company, he gets the chance that he has been waiting for. Unfortunately, she fixes him a once-in-a-lifetime pitching opportunity that clashes with a career-saving presentation - forcing him to choose between going all in or giving up his dream entirely. Co-written by and starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moonlights as a food delivery driver to finance his film, but feels his new job makes him beneath Vanessa, so he struggles to keep it a secret. Things start to look up when he is hired by Funmi to film her eccentric aunt's 60th birthday party, and gets an intriguing tip from an old film school friend. Amy pushes for a promotion at work, and Maurice is anxious about fatherhood. Guest starring Peter Serafinowicz and Jo Martin

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Footballer Troy Deeney, heavyweight boxer Joe Joyce, mixed martial arts star Tom Aspinall, and World Champion swimmer Hannah Miley join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: USA v Netherlands (Kick-off 2.00am). All the action from the Group E encounter at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand, as both teams play their second match. This is a repeat of the 2019 final, which the Americans won 2-0 in France. Reshmin Chowdhury presents, with analysis from Anita Asante and Fern Williams, and commentary by Steve Wyeth and Fara Williams

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A road traffic collision leads to the conviction of a cold-blooded killer, a glamorous casino patron lets police crack an international money laundering scheme and a speeding motorbike prompts officers to arrest a prolific burglar

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle joins a naughty male tiger on a training regime, Kate Humble catches up with a hand-reared cheetah, and the park's staff go in search of British wildlife living freely on the estate

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy Walsh heads to in Rugeley, Staffordshire, to see a three-bed mid-terrace bought by a trio of experienced developers. Martin Roberts is in Cudham in the south-east London Borough of Bromley visiting a two-bed end-terrace cottage bought by a mother to help get her daughter on the property ladder. Jacqui Joseph is in north-west London to see two flats that may be better reverting back to one

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Hele near Exeter. Experts Danny Sebastian and John Cameron help their teams pick three items to take to auction in Honiton. Plus, Natasha discovers more about fossilist Mary Anning

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: At Golitha Falls, where the River Fowey tumbles down to the sea, Rick meets Dawn French, who has made Cornwall her home. In the shadow of Devonport Dockyard, he boards the world's busiest chain ferry to cross the wide River Tamar, the ancient watery boundary between Devon and Cornwall - along the way discovering an unusual event involving circus elephant. And he meets a man who thinks he has discovered the next superfood, which Rick used to cook up a delicious duck dish

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Sunderland-born actress Melanie Hill, formerly of Coronation Street, joins Robson on his pursuit of outdoor activities to help relax and recharge. They travel to one of the UK's biggest waterfalls, High Force

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in Derbyshire with a recently married couple who are making an epic location shift and swapping the Blue Mountains in Australia for the wilds of the Peak District. They have a significant budget of £750,000 and have their hearts set on a character home with a large garden for their three dogs. Away from his quest, Jules comes across an unlikely centre of manufacturing nestled in the county's rural countryside

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Gosport couple Nicola and David met on stage so they want the team to turn their unloved garden into the ultimate, theatrical showstopper. Can Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull give them a space to entertain their friends and perform some of their amateur dramatic favourites, while also providing a quiet haven for wildlife, for £6,000?

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst embark on the fourth leg of their jaunt in their camper van. They head to Blackpool, with items including a prancing leather horse and a nutcracker

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the usual mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey worries she has a stalker and when she receives flowers from her private client, she realises he knows where she lives. Alfie gets on the wrong side of his new boss on his first day, but manages to impress her by resolving a fight between Freddie and Patrick. Anna takes drastic steps to help Sharon and Linda repair their friendship

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey encourages members of the Patel family to tidy their immediate environment, as mum Bijal, dad Darshan and their two children move all their possessions into a warehouse, where they are encouraged to recycle, donate and sell items. There are emotional moments as the quartet go through their most treasured items. Bijal and Darshan struggle to part with their possessions, but really want to create an environment free of the chaos for their son, who finds it hard to concentrate in the clutter. As usual, home improvement gurus Dilly Carter, Iwan Carrington and Robert Bent offer tidying and upcycling tips

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Actress Lesley Manville researches her family tree. So far as her mother's side is concerned, by delving deep into Brighton's local archives, Lesley uncovers a complex story of wartime separation, adultery and the inaccessibility of divorce. Tracing back her father's line sees Lesley trying to solve what happened to her ancestor Aaron Harding. A widower with a large family to feed, Aaron protested poor conditions and pay as an agricultural worker in 1830 - a protest that would become known as the Swing Riots. He was arrested and subsequently transported to Australia

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Previously with Shane Todd
programme.desc: The comedian casts a millennial's eye over the rich pickings of the BBC archive. This instalment features a man who can communicate with chickens, Anneka Rice getting a cheeky proposition from the pokeman and people's reaction to the great soda farl shortage of 1976. Shane also brings his own brand of humour in original new sketches throughout

programme.title: The Accountant (2016)
programme.desc: Autistic number-cruncher Christian Wolff moonlights as a money launderer for the Mob. However, the Treasury Department start closing in on him, so he decides to take on a legitimate client in the form of a robotics company. As he works through their books, he uncovers a discrepancy involving millions of dollars. Thriller action, starring Ben Affleck, Anna Kendrick and JK Simmons

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: England v Denmark (Kick-off 9.30am). All the action from both teams' second match in Group D, held at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. The sides last met in 2019, when England won a friendly 2-0 in Walsall, and the European champions will be hopeful of another victory this morning as they continue their bid to add this trophy to their collection. Alex Scott presents, with analysis from Steph Houghton and Rachel Brown-Finnis, and commentary by Robyn Cowen and Rachel Brown-Finnis

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles hosts from Southwell Racecourse in Nottinghamshire. Experts Gary Pe and David Harper help the reds and blues decide which three items to spend their £300 on that they hope will make a profit at the auction in Lincoln. Eric also pays a visit to the Lincoln Vintage Vehicle Society to learn about the old craft of coachbuilding.

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick heads into the county's china clay pits to discover what is known locally as white gold, one of its most important industries. He then climbs the Cornish Alps, huge slag heaps created by the clay mining and some of Cornwall's highest land. After a wild swim at one of Cornwall's picturesque hidden coves, Rick cooks a simple sea bass recipe, revealing how to make the perfect mayonnaise. In the far west of the county, on the Land's End peninsula, Rick meets his niece, a modern artist, who explains her deep spiritual connection to Cornwall

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by his Uncle Matheson to test a night in a local youth hostel. They sign up for a cookery class, take a guided walk on Hadrian's Wall and visit remote honey bee hives

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley meets a couple who are looking to return to their Welsh homeland after 20 years of living in Oxford. The pair have a budget of £450,000 to find the right home in Carmarthenshire with enough land to accommodate visiting friends and their pooches. Elsewhere, Ginny samples a regional delicacy at Britain's only manufacturer of pickled cockles

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull are challenged to turn a tired old garden into a space inspired by the Middle East. John and Vanessa want a garden reminiscent of Oman, the desert kingdom where they first met. The large raised planter right outside the back doors - nicknamed the sarcophagus - is outdated and dominates the garden, and John and Vanessa are desperate for it to go, but they are keen for the materials to be reused to make the most of their £4,000 budget

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Tim Medhurst and Margie Cooper shop for a final time, stuffed with celebratory Bakewell tarts. A bulldog gong and an old toy do battle at the final auction in Buckinghamshire

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Alex Jones round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Josh Quigley was pushed to the brink by alcohol. However, his life took a remarkable turn when he embarked on a transformative journey, cycling around the world. Now, fuelled by a second chance, he pushes himself to the limits in pursuit of a coveted spot in the World Championships. This documentary recounts a story of resilience and strength, where the power of never giving up offers a profound reason to live

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League striker Kevin Campbell, European champion sprinter Adam Gemili, Ashes-winning cricketer Ashley Giles and world 800m and 4x400m bronze medallist Jenny Meadows join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer Tom Allen, former Blue Peter presenter Sarah Greene, rugby star Ugo Monye and comedian Morgana Robinson join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy prepares a special meal so she and Lee can enjoy an evening in without distractions to discuss the state of their marriage. However, Lee becomes obsessed with a strange beeping noise in the house that he can't find - and the food is soon forgotten. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Comedy about a self-made man struggling to keep his head above water as the 1980s turn into the 1990s. Martin Parker has the ambition of Alan Sugar and the swagger of Robert Kilroy Silk. With a chain of electrical stores bearing his name, he seems to have it all. However the truth is he swimming in debt, his complicated private life is catching up with him and he's starting to lose his power. Written by and starring Sian Gibson, with Conleth Hill, Rosie Cavaliero, George Costigan, Sheila Reid and Jason Barnett

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Spider-Man: Far from Home (2019)
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Avengers' climactic battle for the fate of the universe, the teenage webslinger just wants life to get back to normal. A school trip across Europe seems just the thing - but he ends up recruited by spy agency SHIELD to battle an invasion by elemental monsters from another dimension. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Tom Holland, Jake Gyllenhaal, Zendaya and Samuel L Jackson

programme.desc: The private notice question in the House of Lords on whether the government has plans to assist with the repatriation of holidaymakers from Rhodes following the recent wildfires, from Tuesday 25 July

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Russia is supplying the Myanmar military with advanced fighter jets and training their pilots how to use them in a war against their own people. More than two years on from the coup, the country's military is facing a countrywide armed uprising and their troops are struggling to hold ground and recruit foot soldiers. So, the strategy is turning increasingly to the air with devastating consequences. BBC's Asia editor Rebecca Henschke follows those fighting back on the ground and in the air. And she meets defectors from the air force who give exclusive insight into the strategy and psychology behind those operating these deadly machines.

programme.title: The Arts Interviews

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: Actor and film-maker Kenneth Branagh talks to John Wilson about the key influences and inspirations that have shaped his own work. He touches on his working-class upbringing in late 1960s Northern Ireland at the start of the Troubles, traces the beginnings of his passion for Shakespeare back to the discovery of LP recordings of Laurence Olivier and John Gielgud and reveals his admiration for Alan Bleasdale's 1980s TV series Boys from the Blackstuff

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Russia is supplying the Myanmar military with advanced fighter jets and training their pilots how to use them in a war against their own people. More than two years on from the coup, the country's military is facing a countrywide armed uprising and their troops are struggling to hold ground and recruit foot soldiers. So, the strategy is turning increasingly to the air with devastating consequences. BBC's Asia editor Rebecca Henschke follows those fighting back on the ground and in the air. And she meets defectors from the air force who give exclusive insight into the strategy and psychology behind those operating these deadly machines.

programme.title: Click
programme.desc: Spencer Kelly goes behind the scenes at CERN - home to the Large Hadron Collider and one of the largest scientific research centres in the world. He explores how the centre's cutting-edge research may help treat cancer in the future, how the science here has inspired authors of science fiction, and visits the Antimatter Factory.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: The Arts Interviews
programme.desc: In a joint exclusive interview to mark the one-year anniversary of the ABBA Voyage show, ABBA's Bjorn Ulvaeus and Benny Andersson sit down with Newsnight's Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to actor and film-maker Kenneth Branagh In a wide-ranging conversation, Branagh reveals some of his most formative artistic experiences and his creative process. He remembers his working class upbringing in late 1960s Northern Ireland at the start of the Troubles, as explored in his most personal film to date, Belfast. Branagh also traces the beginnings of his love for Shakespeare back to the discovery of LP recordings of Laurence Olivier and John Gielgud, and reveals his admiration for Thomas Hardy and the Alan Bleasdale's 1980s television series The Boys from the Blackstuff

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: Sgeulachd Cogaidh na h-Artaig/Untold Arctic Wars
programme.desc: Documentary series that reveals the big picture of events in the Arctic during the Second World War. It shows the importance of the battles in that arena for the course of events for the war in general. The series dives deep into secret events and agreements between different parties, revealing the world-class game played in the Arctic. From the history research point of view, the Arctic is a gold mine - the area was a playground for a big political thriller centring around natural resources vital for the war industry

programme.desc: The Great War is finally over and a new era is about to start. Amidst the grief, disappointment and old fears, new dreams and hopes are now emerging but so too are new hatreds

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: One of Fraochy's meanest shopkeepers drives a hard bargain

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Japan v Costa Rica (Kick-off 6.00am). Live coverage of both teams' second match in Group C, held at Dunedin Stadium in New Zealand. Japan are former champions and will expect to take the three points this morning. With commentary by Tom Gayle and Siobhan Chamberlain

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Canada v Republic of Ireland (Kick-off 1.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from both teams' second Group B match, held at Perth Rectangular Stadium. Canada are the reigning Olympic champions and sure to provide a tough test for a Republic side that have qualified for the finals for the first time. With analysis from Eni Aluko and Emma Byrne, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lucy Ward

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking contestants Richie, Rachael and Craig to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Oli, Sophie, Cina and Bob pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.desc: Jai has a surprise. Wendy worries she has blown it. Things are awkward between Nicky and Suni

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sarah discovers her paternity test letter in Stephen's flat, Amy accuses Courtney of toying with Aadi, Paul introduces Shelly to Billy, and Todd's hope of a pay rise evaporates

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Spice Trail Adventure
programme.desc: The last leg of Joanna Lumley's journey takes her by dhow to Zanzibar, the spice island of Africa where merchants from around the world have left their mark on the architecture, religion and music. Finally, she travels to Jordan where the spice trail continued on land. She explores the vast plains of Wadi Rum from the back of a camel, meets one of the last nomadic Bedouin families and visits Za'atari refugee camp, home to Jordan's newest arrivals. Her journey ends at the one of the great wonders of the world, the ancient city of Petra

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: 22 Jump Street (2014)
programme.desc: Undercover cops Schmidt and Jenko are sent on a new assignment at a university. When one joins the college American football team and the other falls in with a crowd of Bohemian artists, loyalty to their new cliques puts a strain on their friendship. Crime comedy, starring Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum

programme.title: Exposure
programme.desc: This intimate documentary follows the story of one woman's extraordinary struggle over five years to bring the man who raped her to justice - a man accused of scores of assaults and rapes against women who applied for work at his London escort agency. The film follows 'Sam', with complete access to her story - from revealing her rape, through 18 months in a safe house and botched police investigations, to her discovery of other victims and crucial evidence

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Omid Djalili hosts the quiz show in which contestants use their wits to get through to the final, where the combination of numbers they are assigned represents the amount of money they play for. Which of today's nine - Brett, Jamal, Nicky, Billy, Faye, Fadekemi, Karen, Lee and Chris - will be playing for the jackpot?

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: As a population we're living longer than ever before, but the years we're adding to our lives aren't necessarily the healthiest. In the UK, people are living on average 12 years in poor health - 14 per cent longer than in 1990. But what can we do to stop that? In the second of two Tonight programmes looking at healthy ageing, journalist Kate Quilton looks at the impact our diet can have on our later years

programme.title: Next Level Chef
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Paul Ainsworth and Nyesha Arrington front the culinary challenge which sees a mixture of home cooks and professional chefs competing across a three-storey kitchen. This week the contestants go Italian - but the kitchen in which each of them works, from the swanky top floor to the dingy basement, depends on how well they did last week

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: One week into the Covid lockdown in 2020, builder Rob murders his legal secretary wife Kelly and their two children before turning the gun on himself. Kelly's identical twin sister, who is 160 miles away, senses that something is wrong immediately. Using text messages, family archive, and interviews with friends, family, the police and Emma - Kelly's twin sister - this episode looks at the downward spiral of coercive control and gun laws that led to a family's horrific death

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: The Red Arrows fly over the airport during the Queen's Jubilee celebrations, but Passenger Experience Manager Suki has to wake a passenger and get him onboard a flight to Toronto. Also racing to catch their flight are a mother and daughter flying to South Africa to attend a close family relative's funeral. Emotions run high as time ticks away without the correct paperwork, so it's down to Passenger Experience Manager Harry to come to the rescue - but is it already too late?

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at the impact of summer in the northern hemisphere and winter in the south, revealing that wildlife faces feast, famine, fire and torrential rain in different regions around the world. On Marion Island life has frozen to a standstill, with king penguin chicks facing starvation as their parents left months ago, while in northern Australia it's the dry season, and hooded parrots raise their chicks in termite mounds

programme.desc: Simon takes steps to safeguard his interests when members of the landed gentry visit both his and Oliver's shops. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Middleditch makes a surprise return to the hospital in the back of an ambulance, having hurt his ankle while fishing. Stella grudgingly welcomes Marian McKaig as her room-mate, but the new nurse quickly catches Alun's eye. Meanwhile, a frantic mother calls for Mike's help at a hippie commune, where her hostile husband is refusing help from the outside world. Ian Carmichael rejoins the series, which continues from earlier in the year. With Ted Robbins

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A patient is admitted with a fever and a swollen arm covered in black lesions, but Mike is nowhere to be seen. Blood tests confirm a case of anthrax, prompting an investigation by the Public Health Officer. Elsewhere, a specialist is summoned when a woman's dizzy spells cause concern, while Alun and Lizzie are intrigued by the mysterious appearance of a young woman

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Steve is forced to cover for Phil when the father-to-be discovers Gina has gone into labour two months early and rushes to the hospital to help with the nerve-racking delivery. Meanwhile, Merton is excited when it appears a drug dealer could soon be brought to justice. Drama, starring Mark Jordon, Tricia Penrose and Duncan Bell

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jenny falls victim to conmen who have devised an elaborate loan and savings racket to fleece unwitting villagers. Meanwhile, Vernon, Bernie and David put their literary prowess to the test by entering a poetry competition run by the Ashfordly Gazette. Rural drama, starring Sarah Tansey and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tracy's illusions are shattered after telling Shelley she thinks Dev is about to propose, and Tony tries to resolve his differences with Eileen

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: David Jason returns as DI Jack Frost in this feature-length episode. Faced with the death of a police informant on an estate riven with racial tension, the detective finds his patience pushed to the limit. Bruce Alexander and Lennie James also star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Crane and Merton have their hands full when a sniper strikes during a clay-pigeon shoot, and Bellamy's fiery temper only serves to make matters worse. Elsewhere, Vernon decides to venture into the B&B market - but his cooking skills leave a lot to be desired. Rural drama, starring James Carlton, Duncan Bell, Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Dr Liz Merrick is mortified when one of her patients dies of an insulin overdose, but even more so when Sgt Merton is forced to investigate her responsibility. Meanwhile, Vernon Scripps embarks on a mission to make Aidensfield sparkle with his own brand of cleaning products. Drama, starring Aislin McGuckin and Duncan Bell

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When dock worker Owen Thorne plunges from the roof of a multi-storey car park while picking up his daughter from her school prom, Vera immediately detects foul play. The team soon discovers a work dispute over the death of a young man, with everyone believing Owen was to blame, and the victim's father admits he wanted revenge - but his alibi holds. The mystery then continues when Vera spots an inconsistency in the statement Owen's wife gave to the police, suggesting she's not certain of her husband's fidelity

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin are mystified by the murders of a popular couple who were stabbed to death while they slept. Lacking any leads to possible grievances held or enemies made, the detectives suspect a case of mistaken identity, and the previous owner of the house - a banker caught up in a hedge-fund scandal - emerges as the more likely target. Guest starring Samuel West

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: As the investigation into the cold-case murder continues, the forensic team discovers that the marks on the victim's body are consistent with known gangland torture methods. With this in mind, Cassie and Sunny question Sir Phillip about his involvement with a prominent East End crime family 40 years ago. Did the businessman or any of the shady associates of his youth have anything to do with Jimmy's disappearance or murder? Meanwhile, Eric and Claire's anniversary gets under way. Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker, Sanjeev Bhaskar, Trevor Eve and Tom Courtenay

Rural drama, starring James Carlton, Ian East, Peter Benson, David Lonsdale and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Alf Ventress mounts a large-scale surveillance operation in an effort to track down the wool thief responsible for de-fleecing sheep in Aidensfield. Bernie finds himself in hot water when an estranged son arrives to bury his father - who is already six feet under. Drama, starring James Carlton and Peter Benson

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa worries Dr Timoney's suggestion that she and Martin aren't meant to be together might have prompted him to leave Portwenn for good. Calling on Ruth, Morwenna and Janice for help, she tries to track the down the missing GP, with no luck. However, what Dr Ellingham's friends and family fail to realise is that he is actually trapped up at the Winton farm, where desperate wife Annie is trying to coerce him into performing a life-saving operation on her terminally ill husband Jim. Meanwhile, Ruth and Bert seek out Al to offer him a proposition regarding the whisky and the B&B. Medical drama, starring Martin Clunes

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Portwenn is abuzz with activity for the preparation of Janice and Penhale's wedding, but a medical issue could prevent Penhale from making it down the aisle. Meanwhile, Al is struggling with the demands of being best man, especially when Bert's marketing antics mean there is only whisky available at the pre-wedding party. Martin Clunes and John Marquez star

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The team struggles to understand the involvement of 12-year-old Kaden Blake in the shooting of mother and carer Lia Brown. As a victim of gang culture, the boy's only protection is keeping silent, and by speaking out about the crime, he sets in motion a devastating chain of events. Guest starring Lucy Speed (EastEnders, The Bill), with Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: As Cassie and Sunny continue their investigation into the cold-case murder, the net tightens around the people whose names were found in the victim's diary. Sir Phillip Cross makes a difficult decision to salvage what is left of his reputation while at the same time protecting his family, Father Robert comes clean to the police and Ray returns home to find Lizzie gone. Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar, with Trevor Eve, Bernard Hill, Tom Courtenay, Ruth Sheen and Brian Bovell

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Father Robert's revelations prove to have lasting repercussions, especially for Caroline when she goes into premature labour. Bella and Josh deliberate over the best way to deal with their father, the search for Lizzie continues and Maureen is finally able to lay Jimmy to rest. Conclusion of the crime drama, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar, with Bernard Hill, Tamzin Malleson, Zoe Telford, Trevor Eve, Tom Courtenay and Tom Austen

programme.desc: After plummeting 15 feet onto concrete and his head taking the full impact of the fall, a man is rushed into resus with a significant laceration to his head. Meanwhile, a 38-year-old suffers a number of life-threatening fits after a potential blackout in falling downstairs, and another patient is rushed in after being run over by his own van

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Doctors treat Craig, a window-fitter who has fallen from a ladder and has been knocked unconscious. He has a huge gash to the back on his head, but the medical staff are concerned he may have also seriously injured his neck and spine. Meanwhile, Advanced Nurse Practitioner Dave Sagol meets 61-year-old June, who has been rushed into the hospital with swollen legs and having difficulty breathing

programme.title: Skin A&E

programme.title: Coastguard: Search & Rescue SOS

programme.title: Henry VIII: Rise of a Tyrant
programme.desc: Three-part drama-documentary series revealing the truth about England's most infamous King, King Henry VIII. The second episode takes viewers on a journey through the turbulent marriages, affairs and tyrannical politics of King Henry VIII's reign, and explores how Henry's obsession with marrying Anne Boleyn resulted in a cataclysmic and hugely unpopular split with the Roman Catholic Church. The programme also examines Henry's relationship with his new chief advisor and enforcer, Thomas Cromwell, who would come to bear the brunt of the King's increasing unhinged behaviour in the years to come. Narrated by Jason Isaacs

programme.title: Alex Polizzi's Secret Italy
programme.desc: Alex begins the third leg of her journey in Naples, a busy and chaotic city with a population of around 960,000, and learns what it is like to live in the shadow of Vesuvius, the volcano that famously erupted in 79AD and destroyed the town of Pompeii. Alex then heads to the spectacular Amalfi coast, the destination for part of her honeymoon, and samples the cuisine at the Villa Cimbrone in Ravello, where chef Mamma Agata has catered for stars including Humphrey Bogart, Richard Burton, Liz Taylor and Fred Astaire

programme.title: Surgeons: A Matter of Life or Death
programme.desc: Dan, 37, faces one of the hardest waits of his life. Diagnosed with primary sclerosing cholangitis - a disease that is causing his bile ducts and liver to fail - his only chance of survival is a liver transplant. A potential donor has been found, and now the race is on to assess the liver's viability. Once in surgery, Mr Bartlett works against the clock to quickly remove the old, diseased liver. But while trying to restore the blood supply to the new organ, there's a worrying lack of blood pressure

programme.title: Inside the Force: 24/7
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes at Lincoln's West Parade police station, beginning by focusing on the custody suite as a procession of challenging suspects is brought in. Among the situations Sergeant Dan has to deal with are a Friday-night reveller who headbutts one of the arresting officers, and an angry environmentalist who strips completely naked at the front desk

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc: Officers a hunt for a car linked to an Albanian organised crime gang, which leads to large quantities of drugs found concealed inside the body of the vehicle. programme.title: Henry VIII: Rise of a Tyrant
programme.desc: The series concludes with a look at the king's final years, when the pain caused by an infected ulcer on his leg had a detrimental impact on his increasingly angry temperament. Lauren Johnson examines the king's exotic diet, including meat from porpoises and seals, and considers its impact on both his weight and his health. Plus, a look at a Catholic rebellion and the breakdown of Henry's relationship with advisor Thomas Cromwell

programme.title: Alex Polizzi's Secret Italy
programme.desc: For the final leg of her journey, the hotelier heads to the south, a region she knows little about. In Puglia, she marvels at the local beehive-shaped dry stone huts and samples a wine with a difference, before heading to the Monte Pollino national park. Alex concludes her adventure in the city of Matera, where she attends the annual Festa della Madonna Bruna, a week-long carnival culminating in a pagan-style rite of destruction and a firework display

programme.title: Kew Gardens: A Year in Bloom
programme.desc: Carlos and Lucy think they have discovered a new third species of giant waterlily previously unknown to science, and they set about trying to prove their discovery to the world, with the help of their partners in Bolivia. Aaron is looking at ways to replace coffee plants threatened with extinction by climate change, pests and disease, while down at Kew's wild botanic garden Wakehurst, Katie and the tree gang have to deal with some invasive rhododendrons that are threatening the plant collection

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Susan Calman's Grand Week by the Sea
programme.desc: The comedian samples UK seaside resorts, beginning with Clacton-on-Sea, Essex. There she enjoys a whistle-stop tour of the largest pleasure pier in Europe. Susan takes a ride on a ferris wheel, and during theatre rehearsals for a summer show, she is picked to be a magician's assistant. Susan also meets up with actor and comedian Nina Wadia, who reminisces about her first trip to Clacton in her teens

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Part two of two. Concluding part of the series pilot in which John Dutton tries to protect his Montana ranch from land developers, an Indian reservation and America's first national park. Drama, starring Kevin Costner, Luke Grimes and Kelly Reilly

programme.title: Britain's Favourite 80s Songs
programme.desc: Jenny Powell narrates this look back at 1988, when Bros, Belinda Carlisle and Bomb the Bass were riding high in the charts, and Kylie Minogue went from soap icon to pop star. Toyah Willcox, Paul Gambaccini, Cheryl Baker and Sam Fox add their thoughts on the year when Fairground Attraction had a Perfect hit, the Hollies were back in the charts, and Yazz and the Plastic Population breathed new life into 1980 song The Only Way Is Up

programme.title: Queen: Rock the World
programme.desc: Documentary following the band as they recorded their sixth album, News of the World, and made plans for a tour of the US. Back in 1977, broadcaster Bob Harris was granted exclusive access, conducting interviews with all four members, as well as filming them at work in the studio, rehearsing their North American Tour. Until recently, the documentary was never completed and the footage lay unused in the archive. The film is supplemented by footage shot in the summer of 2017 as Brian May and Roger Taylor took Queen back to the US with Adam Lambert as lead singer

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Henry VIII: Rise of a Tyrant
programme.desc: Jason Isaacs narrates a drama-documentary revealing the truth about the English monarch, filmed in historic locations including Hampton Court, Windsor Castle. A team of experts on the Tudors uncovers the real Henry, exploring how his complex personality fundamentally shaped the nation

programme.title: Alex Polizzi's Italian Islands
programme.desc: The hotelier delves further into her heritage by exploring the culture, cuisine and history of the country's most beautiful islands. She begins her tour with a visit to Sardinia, hearing the tales of kidnappings and bandits that have blighted the island's reputation in the past, finding out why there are more centenarians here than anywhere else and meeting a woman who claims to be the last in the world to weave precious sea silk

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Rebecca, a big new tender engine, comes to the Island of Sodor and works so hard not to be late that she keeps leaving stations too early

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The crusading canines guide a lost narwhal back home

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad (1974)
programme.desc: A swashbuckling sailor stumbles across a golden tablet that forms part of a map revealing the way to a magic fountain, which is fabled to bestow untold riches and eternal youth. But first the brave mariner has to battle storms, monsters and the trickery of an evil wizard before he can reach his goal. Fantasy adventure, with John Phillip Law, Tom Baker, Douglas Wilmer, Martin Shaw and Caroline Munro, with effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain (2019)
programme.desc: Thanks to his race car driver owner, golden retriever Enzo learns that the techniques needed on the racetrack can also be used to successfully navigate the journey of life. Comedy drama, starring Milo Ventimiglia and Amanda Seyfried

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes (1955)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama in which eight British Marines carry out a daring operation to canoe into Bordeaux harbour, where they plan to sabotage the German fleet - a mission considered by many to be suicidal. Directed by and starring Jose Ferrer. With Trevor Howard, Dora Bryan and Anthony Newley

programme.title: The Colditz Story (1954)
programme.desc: A medieval castle in Germany is turned into a PoW camp during the Second World War, and used to house the most rebellious Allied prisoners, all of whom have made repeated escape attempts. Although breaking out is supposedly impossible, the determined inmates refuse to be beaten and continue their bid for freedom. Second World War drama, starring John Mills and Eric Portman

programme.title: Airplane II: The Sequel (1982)
programme.desc: Hapless hero Ted Striker tries to prevent the launch of a passenger space shuttle, certain it will end in disaster. Sadly, his prediction comes true when a computer malfunction sends the spacecraft hurtling toward the sun, while a man driven mad by sexual inadequacy smuggles a bomb on board. Disaster movie spoof sequel, starring Robert Hays, Julie Hagerty, Lloyd Bridges, William Shatner, Sonny Bono and Chad Everett

programme.title: Armageddon (1998)
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi

programme.title: Happy Death Day 2U (2019)
programme.desc: College student Tree Gelbman repeatedly lived through her own murder at the hands of a killer in a baby mask, until she learned how to outwit him and escape her fate. However, she is now stuck in another murderous time-loop, and has to face up to a fresh killer. Horror comedy sequel, starring Jessica Rothe, Israel Broussard and Phi Vu

programme.title: Loving Vincent (2017)
programme.desc: Animated biographical drama examining the life of painter Vincent van Gogh, focusing on the circumstances of his death. The production, which utilised 65,000 oil-painted frames, features the voices of Douglas Booth, Robert Gulaczyk and Eleanor Tomlinson

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan (1984)
programme.desc: Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and company try to take Broadway by storm with their college show, setting the stage for a host of misadventures as they yearn for stardom in the Big Apple and set out to raise the money to finance their production. Comedy, performed by Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with appearances by Liza Minnelli, Art Carney, Dabney Coleman, Gregory Hines, Joan Rivers, Brooke Shields, Linda Lavin and Elliott Gould

programme.title: Bee Movie (2007)
programme.desc: A bee wearies of a life dedicated to producing honey and decides to leave his hive. During his foray into the wider world, he befriends a florist. However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock

programme.title: It Came from Beneath the Sea (1954)
programme.desc: The captain of a nuclear submarine battles a gigantic octopus threatening to destroy San Francisco. Monster adventure, starring Kenneth Tobey, Faith Domergue and Donald Curtis, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Earth vs the Flying Saucers (1956)
programme.desc: Aliens arrive on Earth with an ultimatum - surrender or face death - prompting humanity to pull out all the stops to find a way of defeating the extraterrestrial menace. Sci-fi drama, starring Hugh Marlowe, Joan Taylor, Donald Curtis and Morris Ankrum, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind (1977)
programme.desc: An electrical repairman sees a fleet of UFOs and develops an increasing fascination with mountain-shaped forms, driving his wife to despair. Meanwhile, another woman has a similar fixation after her son mysteriously vanishes, and a team of scientists investigates a series of strange events around the world. Eventually, they are all drawn to a mountain where aliens are about to make contact. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi drama, starring Richard Dreyfuss, Francois Truffaut and Teri Garr

programme.title: Another Round (2020)
programme.desc: Martin, Tommy, Peter and Nikolaj - colleagues and friends who are teachers at the same Copenhagen high school - decide to consume alcohol on a daily basis to see how it affects their social and professional lives. Thomas Vinterberg's comedy drama, starring Mads Mikkelsen, Thomas Bo Larsen and Magnus Millang. In Danish and Swedish

programme.title: Dune (1984)
programme.desc: A far-flung galactic empire is sustained by a priceless mind-expanding spice found only on a desolate desert world. Rival factions seeking to take over production plunge the planet into war, while the native people await the coming of a prophesied saviour who will lead them to freedom. David Lynch's sci-fi fantasy based on Frank Herbert's novel, starring Kyle MacLachlan, Francesca Annis, Sting, Patrick Stewart and Kenneth McMillan

programme.title: The Oak Room (2020)
programme.desc: During a raging snowstorm, a drifter returns home to the blue-collar bar located in the remote Canadian town where he was born. When he offers to settle an old debt with a grizzled bartender by telling him a story, the night's events quickly spin into a dark tale of mistaken identities, double-crosses and shocking violence. Mystery thriller, starring RJ Mitte, Ari Millen and Peter Outerbridge

programme.title: Alpha and Omega (2010)
programme.desc: Humphrey the wolf is at the bottom of his pack's pecking order, and harbours a hopeless crush on Kate, the daughter of their leader. When the two animals are relocated by well-meaning park rangers, they must work together if they are to make it back to their natural habitat. Animated adventure, with the voices of Justin Long, Hayden Panettiere and Dennis Hopper

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011)
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

programme.title: The Desert Rats (1953)
programme.desc: A Scottish army officer is placed in command of a unit of Australian troops given the task of defending Tobruk against overwhelming German forces, led by the renowned general Rommel. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Burton, Robert Newton and James Mason, reprising his role as Rommel from The Desert Fox

programme.title: Gunfight at the OK Corral (1957)
programme.desc: US Marshal Wyatt Earp lays down his badge to live a peaceful life with his brothers in the town of Tombstone. As a feud erupts with the ruthless Clanton gang, he forms an unlikely alliance with hard-drinking gambler Doc Holliday to face them in a historic showdown. Western, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas, Dennis Hopper, Lee Van Cleef and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: The Mountain Between Us (2017)
programme.desc: An English neurosurgeon desperate to attend an operation crosses paths with an American bride-to-be determined to get to her wedding. When their chartered flight crashes, they attempt to survive in the wilderness, while fighting their attraction to each other. Romantic adventure, starring Idris Elba, Kate Winslet and Beau Bridges

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel (2019)
programme.desc: In the 26th century, dismantled cyborg Alita is repaired by Dr Dyson Ido, a kindly technician with a dark secret. As she falls in love with local youth Hugo, the truth behind her mysterious past is eventually revealed. Director Robert Rodriguez's Sci-fi adventure based on the manga comic, starring Rosa Salazar, Christoph Waltz and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: Race with the Devil (1975)
programme.desc: Two couples embark on a road trip in a camper van. However, their holiday takes an unexpected turn when they witness a human sacrifice. When the local police find no evidence of the ritual, the holiday-makers continue on their way - only to be pursued and attacked by the Satanic cult responsible. Thriller, starring Peter Fonda, Warren Oates, Loretta Swit and Lara Parker

programme.title: Rosemary's Baby (1968)
programme.desc: A couple move into a new apartment, and the husband forms a close friendship with their elderly neighbours. The wife soon becomes pregnant, and starts to suspect her spouse has been seduced into a Satanic cult, who have sinister plans for her baby. Roman Polanski's horror, based on the novel by Ira Levin, and starring Mia Farrow, John Cassavetes, Oscar-winner Ruth Gordon, Sidney Blackmer and Ralph Bellamy

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: John Paul battles with the idea of reporting his attack to the police, and Romeo begins to have doubts about Rayne's intentions

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Yazz and Tom decide to take some time to think things through, Mercedes needs to ask for a favour, and Peri wants to find out why Romeo is ghosting her

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Philadelphia to help failing Mexican restaurant Zocalo. Owners Greg and Mary Russell met and fell in love while they were working there, and the place held such sentimental importance to them they pooled their money and bought it. Now Gordon tries to turn things around before the floundering business ruins their marriage and tears their family apart

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Fremont, California, in an attempt to save a restaurant that is tearing the owners' marriage apart.
