Unfortunately, his comments are so inappropriate that he is accused of sexual harassment and sent to the university's human resources department, where he ends up dragging Leonard, Raj and Howard into trouble too. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When Jake's favourite pizzeria burns down, the fire marshal (Patton Oswalt) believes the owner should be the prime suspect in the investigation. Outraged, the detective does everything in his power to prove him wrong, even if it means stepping outside his jurisdiction. Meanwhile, chaos ensues at the precinct after a computer virus publishes everyone's internet browser history

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Santiago hosts a Thanksgiving dinner at her apartment for all her colleagues, but the event risks turning into a disaster, especially when Holt and Peralta have to leave in a hurry to catch a thief who has stolen a large sum of money from the evidence lock-up. Can Boyle save the day?

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave earns Calvin's respect when he thwarts a robbery at the barbershop, until the recognition goes to his head and he starts exaggerating the truth

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Victor Alvarez, owner of Motor Boys, tries to steal Calvin's customers, the Butlers and Johnsons join forces on a plan to drum up business and give back to their community

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Mauritius to find out about white and dark rum and learns where the term 'proof' originally came from in relation to alcohol

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lynne and her sister Debbie seek the perfect place on the beautiful Costa Teguise in Lanzarote. After Lynne's husband Frankie was diagnosed with a terminal illness, Lynne took early retirement to care for him. A holiday home in the sun has been a lifelong dream for this couple, and with Frankie's illness they don't want to wait any longer. With a budget of £150,000, Ben Hillman lines up five suitable properties for them to choose between

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A family of five begin searching for their dream home in Italy, and it's panic stations in France as the glampsite hosts prepare for their first guests

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Wales, where Henry restores a Royal Enfield motorbike, converting it into a classic cafe racer. Simon's choice of an old school house radiator springs a leak, but he gets an 1980s pinball machine back to its best

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien search for more items to fix up and sell on, visiting Windsor to meet Pete and Phil, who rent out cars to the film and TV business. Henry finds an Austrian moped which is missing an engine, while Simon picks a fibreglass suit of armour

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for the heirs of a newly advertised estate, and learn that a family member once made lace for Queen Victoria. Plus, two sisters embark on a journey of discovery when it is revealed they are descendants of someone they never knew existed

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate officers work on the case of a £1.3million estate belonging to a retired policeman and share the story of an investigation that took them to Ireland. Plus, the team reveals more details of unclaimed assets

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Brigitte Tee, who runs four-star B&B Gorse Meadow in the New Forest, hosts the first round of the competition. Her guests are initially charmed by her eccentric personality, but the discovery of a bathroom window in need of repair and another room containing ladybirds, cobwebs and dust soon takes the shine off their stay

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants head to Lynton in north Devon, where they stay at Alistair and Emma Mundell's four-star Castle Hill Guesthouse. The pair only opened the B&B three months prior to the competition, and hope to impress with their recently renovated rooms, but Brigitte Tee proves hard to win over. Two of their guests are also forced to overcome their fears during a trip on a Victorian cliff railway

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves north to Blackpool and the three-star Vidella B&B run by John Downer and Neil Williams. The pair rig Blackpool-hater Alistair Mundell's room with practical jokes, and take their guests to Funny Girls drag cabaret bar, where Mark Crib confesses he has never had such a surreal time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Crib welcomes the group to the Urban Beach in Bournemouth, Dorset, for the week's final B&B visit. The boutique establishment features chic rooms with deluxe bathrooms, and the guests approve of the afternoon's activity - a speedboat ride along the Jurassic coast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Brigitte Tee is upset to discover she has been given only one point for cleanliness and a heated exchange results in a walk-out, before the winner is announced

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: African painted dogs K'mana and Ville were thrown together as a breeding couple after the dominant female died, but K'mana was never Ville's first choice as partner and still carries a limp from her battles with Ville's previous mate. Now she is pregnant with the zoo's first ever litter of this rare and endangered species. Meanwhile, keepers try to rekindle interest between Okapi pair Dicky and Stuma, and Atlas moths Dave and Simon only have five days of life after hatching, and their sole purpose is to mate

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Woodgreen animal charity staff set about matching their homeless dogs with more prospective owners. Eighty-five-year-old Pim thinks Dexter the beagle is as stubborn as Elizabeth, his wife of 62 years. It's possible that shy Jack Russell Roxy could prove a better match. Chihuahuas Bear and Dave try to convince seven-year-old husky-fan Ollie that two little dogs are better than one

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Dorran, who has taken on the ambitious task of building a super-modern underground home on a hill outside Canterbury. He entrusts the work to a team of contractors, but when delays and rising costs force him to take charge of the build himself, Dorran faces the biggest challenge of his life, juggling his time between the site and his work as a ship's master out on the North Sea. However, having promised the house to his wife and children, he knows that failure is not an option

programme.title: Bismarck: 24 Hours to Doom
programme.desc: Documentary about the famous Second World War naval battle, charting the sinking of HMS Hood by the German Navy's newest and most powerful battleship, the Bismarck. Based on Iain Ballantyne's best-selling book 24 Hours to Doom, the programme provides a thrilling countdown of the Bismarck's final 24 hours

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The wife and carer of an 80-year-old patient whose dementia is progressing reflects on 53 years together as a couple, and her story has a profound effect on nurse Josey. A staff member from the Neurology Department has an epileptic seizure, and a diving coach is in Minor Injuries with a fractured ankle after falling while ice skating

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The department treats a 31-year-old biker who was involved in a head-on collision, and a teenager left with injuries to his hand after punching through a window. Plus, Resus team members struggle to revive two elderly patients, and discuss what they would want done for them in a similar situation

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Hartlepool, the heli-medics treat a man who's been hit by a train. Cyclist Trevor suffers serious injuries after a collision with a car. Plus, in Cumbria, 12-year-old motocross biker Arai is flown across the country for emergency surgery on a deep chest wound

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics Jan Vann and Chelsie Kennedy rush to a road traffic collision, but find the driver of the car has left the vehicle and doesn't want to be treated by the crew. The police suspect he may have been drinking, but the crew need to convince him to receive their help. In Coventry, paramedics Neil and Laura rush to a two-year-old boy who is having a severe allergic reaction

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The wife and carer of an 80-year-old patient whose dementia is progressing reflects on 53 years together as a couple, and her story has a profound effect on nurse Josey. A staff member from the Neurology Department has an epileptic seizure, and a diving coach is in Minor Injuries with a fractured ankle after falling while ice skating

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt investigates an intriguing claim about tomato ketchup bottles, Kate Quilton discovers how oysters turned from a Victorian bar snack to a wallet-busting luxury, and Amanda Byram uncovers the difference between medium and large eggs

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton visits the world's largest jelly bean producers to discover what they are made of instead of gelatine, and Matt Tebbutt finds out why maple syrup is so expensive

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Steve and Jane from Eastbourne have been together for 16 years and now wish to buy their very first property together on the Canary Island of Tenerife. They're looking for a town house with some outside space on the northern coast, where they can enjoy holidays with their five children and perhaps relocate permanently to in the next few years. Working with a budget of £200,000, Jasmine Harman sets out to find them their dream home

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Portugal, a B&B gets busy after Covid restrictions ease, a family house-hunts in Italy and a couple in France race to finish renovating their holiday lets. Meanwhile, an ambitious trio hope to start a gin distillery in Spain, but get tied up in red tape

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Max McMurdo head for Crewe to meet rock 'n' roller Billy, who lives in a house that is frozen in time in the 1950s

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Maidenhead, Berkshire, Simon O'Brien falls in love with an old ship's carpenter's chest, while Henry Cole takes away a miniature tether car, which he hopes to get moving again

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for the relatives of a woman who died without leaving a will, and discover that her husband was a Second World War meteorologist. Plus, how an heir hunt that went all the way to Australia reveals the story of mass emigration thanks to the 'ten pound pom' campaign

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detective team searches for an heir to the estate of a woman who led a glamorous life of international travel and adventure. There is the story of an East End couple who chose to raise their disabled daughter at a time when it was against conventional wisdom, plus details of unclaimed estates still awaiting heirs

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jon and Julia Shorrock host the first round of the B&B competition from their four-star Derwent House in West Sussex. The guests are split by gender to sample the area, with the men firing machine guns at a shooting range and the women relaxing at a spa - but a carpeted bathroom and shower without hot water raise questions

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Peter and Sharron Sorsky invite their fellow competitors to Kirkby Park B&B in Liverpool, but the presence of a security camera on the outside of the house leaves one guest feeling uneasy. Room inspections uncover all manner of unsightly problems, but a tour of nearby Knowsley Safari Park gives the contestants a chance to enjoy themselves

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Andy and Julian Banner-Price host the competition at their expensive B&B Plas Dinas Country House in Snowdonia, giving their new guests the priciest rooms. Peter and Sharron Sorsky are still reeling from their feedback forms and immediately find fault with the accommodation, and the group is taken to wash bedding the old-fashioned way at the local slate museum

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Annette McAnespie welcomes the group to Hazelwood Farm in Crayke, North Yorkshire, for the final B&B visit. The initial impressions are favourable and Peter and Jon begin to bond for the first time during a mosaic class, but not everyone feels up to the planned activity of a cycling tour

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time at Annette McAnespie's farm in Crayke, North Yorkshire, to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances, before the week's winner is announced

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Pregnant giraffe Orla goes into labour, but the keepers must watch from the sidelines due to the risks involved during the birth. Baby Bornean orang-utan Tombol tries his luck with the gibbons as he heads out and explores his new habitat. Elsewhere, northern bald ibis chick Professor X is proving too confident for his own good, and when it is time to release him into the adult habitat he gets into troubled waters and suffers a nasty head injury, so the vets have to work hard to help him pull through

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Nine-year-old Kiya is given the best job ever - choosing a new furry friend out of a litter of three tiny cockapoos. Meanwhile, Wingnut the chihuahua has to prove to 16-year-old Jacob that chihuahuas are indeed cool and overexcited Yorkie Bam Bam needs to chill out if he is going to go home with Londoner Hannah

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Harry and Briony Anscombe, who have decided to move from London to Cornwall with their three young children and begin building work on an ambitious house, inspired by American modernist properties. With a budget of just £400,000, Harry opts to project manage himself, paying local builders by the hour, but his lack of experience in construction proves to be problematic

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Mark Evans meets more people who aspire to live in their ultimate waterside dream home. Simon and Mary Sparrow live on a barge in Beccles, Suffolk, with their son Nate and their two cats. The Sparrows have been running a boatyard for nearly 10 years, specialising in refurbishing and renting out floating homes to holidaymakers. Now they're designing and building a new, one-of-a-kind floating home for themselves - a futuristic-looking floating pod, drawing on a budget of £70,000

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia

In 2009, 120 people died nearby at Kinglake in what's now known as the Black Saturday bushfires, so Bel and John need a fireproof home

programme.title: Dogging Tales
programme.desc: True Stories documentary by photographer Leo Maguire, providing an insight into why men and women engage in or watch sexual activity in front of strangers in public areas after dark. programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Hartlepool, the heli-medics treat a man who's been hit by a train. Cyclist Trevor suffers serious injuries after a collision with a car. Plus, in Cumbria, 12-year-old motocross biker Arai is flown across the country for emergency surgery on a deep chest wound

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

Plus, in Warwick, a crew is called to an elderly man who has extreme anxiety and has called emergency services 14 times

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff of King's College Hospital in London face a busy day dealing with brain injuries, including 65-year-old cabbie Charlie Brown, whom doctors worry has suffered a haemorrhage in a car accident, and 89-year-old Peggy Pierce, who has been rushed in following a suspected stroke. In the waiting room, a woman is comforted by her ex-boyfriend while she awaits treatment for a cut finger

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty hops over to France to find out what the white skin on Brie is made of. Helen Lawal explores how candy floss is inspiring a food revolution, while Briony May Williams goes crayfish trapping in a bid to learn why it is not possible to buy them whole in the supermarkets

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp introduces new crafts, skills and techniques for interior decoration. In this edition, she reveals how to create a personalised doormat and coasters, using spray paint, old tiles and serviettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Gloucestershire couple Sarah and Simon fell in love with Fuerteventura 20 years ago and now they want to buy a holiday home there for three generations of their family to enjoy. Laura Hamilton shows them what their £200,000 budget can buy

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the end of the summer approaches, two gite owners in France prepare for their first guests, a business trio embark on a new venture in Spain, and a family-of-five seeks to find its dream home and business in Italy

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Max McMurdo and Simon O'Brien are in Woking, Surrey, where they find a sidecar - to be transformed into a boat - and a water cylinder that Simon might make into a trendy lamp

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Herefordshire to meet former farmer Julian. Henry finds an old cattle feeder that he wants to turn into a garden bench, while Simon hatches plans to turn a vintage seed drill into a trendy dining table

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers try to track down the relatives of a man who became estranged from his family and died without a will, and an heir embarks on a journey of discovery in a bid to understand his late cousin's secret involvement in the Cold War. Plus, more details of unclaimed estates

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The researchers try to track down the next of kin of a Newcastle man with a £100,000 estate who failed to leave a will, while another search unveils an intriguing story about London chimney sweeps in the early 20th century. Plus, details of unclaimed estates that are still in need of heirs

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The sports car-themed PitStop in Hertfordshire hosts the first round, as owners Melvyn and Sindy Rutter try to make a good impression. However, the absence of tea and coffee in the rooms does not go down well with the guests, and Melvyn's after-dinner talk about his collection of Morgan cars fails to spark much interest

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gill and Peter Tydie invite their fellow competitors to stay at the Victory in Mersea, Essex, a four-star B&B with 26 members of staff to run the bar, restaurant and accommodation. A trip to a local fishery gives one contestant an opportunity to annoy his peers, and the discovery of a hole in a bedsheet leaves the hosts feeling uneasy about their chances of success

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave Botha hosts at his Butterfly Paragliding B&B on the Isle of Wight. Deborah Morrison and Wayne Bingham are unhappy they must sleep in a tepee in the garden and use an outdoor toilet, and claim they were served watery eggs and rubbery sausages for breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Deborah Morrison and Wayne Bingham host the final night at Braddon Hall in Torquay, Devon, where Melvyn and Sindy take issue with their squeaky four-poster bed. The hoteliers try to entertain their guests by inviting them to take part in an archery contest - which ends in accusations of unfair play

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. One of the hosts gets upset about large underpayments and a couple interrogate their guests about the criticism in their feedback, before the winner is announced

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chester Zoo's penguins move into a temporary home while a new luxury home is built for them, but the move becomes upsetting when malaria sweeps the colony, with elder Rudd battling to survive against the odds. Meanwhile, the African painted dog pups venture out of their den for the first time, but the runt of the litter Mosi refuses to go out into the cold, and keepers worry she may have issues with her eyesight. Elsewhere, Sumatran orangutan Emma gives birth, and a beetle with a wonky horn has to fight other bachelors in the group to win the attention of a female

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: It's the battle of the cutest as two very different puppies are offered to Sonia and Andy and their two little girls. Recovering from a broken leg, lurcher Manuel is potentially paired with paramedic Luke and partner Kath, while Lauren considers a life in the company of Winnie the Lhasa

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets energy conservationist Andrew, who has decided to build a radical, self-heating home for his family - the first of its kind in the UK. He aims to heat the house all year round by storing the warmth of the summer sun into insulated earth banks over and around the house, and then drawing the warmth back into the living spaces in winter. However, this pioneering construction seems an exercise in trial and error from the start, and what began as a seemingly simple, pure concept becomes a complicated feat of engineering

programme.title: Disturbing Disappearances
programme.desc: Esther Lewanski is leaving the police, but on her last day becomes worried about Julia, a young mother who has disappeared, abandoning her baby Zoe. Despite the team's and Esther's efforts, Julia can't be found and, at the same time, a girl, Charlie, is found drowned. What's the connection between these two young women? Crime drama, starring Alix Poisson. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Patients dealt with at King's College Hospital, London include a man who was stabbed in his own home and has injuries to his lung, arm and liver, and an elderly woman injured in a fall. A former international lawyer who lost his wife, family and home to alcoholism decides to make a change after being treated with care and compassion

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 77-year-old former motorbike racer arrives with a potentially deadly swelling of the main artery that could burst at any moment. His only option is major surgery, which could be dangerous at his age. A woman whose boyfriend was killed in a cycling accident a year previously is also injured while on her bike, and a medical technician and a mobile caterer talk about their roles in aiding people to recovery

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Patients dealt with at King's College Hospital, London include a man who was stabbed in his own home and has injuries to his lung, arm and liver, and an elderly woman injured in a fall. programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Teleshopping

After a whistle-stop shop at Europe's largest covered market, Gino makes his way to the magical ancient site of Nora, where he cooks a succulent tuna dish, prepared as the sun sets over the ruins

programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo arrives in Palermo, the capital city of Sicily, and a place he has never visited before. He ends his day in a nearby vineyard, cooking a succulent chicken in marsala sauce

programme.desc: Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff check out a new hot hatch from Honda and an old hot hatch from Peugeot. Paddy McGuinness takes on his toughest challenge to date: getting a team of young amateur racers up to professional motorsport standard, in just two months

programme.desc: Moira decides to cook dinner with David's help, Johnny looks at an office for his business, and Alexis comes clean with Ted. Comedy, starring Eugene Levy

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo reveals how Sicily's fascinating history has influenced the food its people eat and the ingredients they use. Crossing the island and taking in the beautiful baroque towns of Noto and Modica, Gino learns about chocolate and cassada. Travelling past the temples of Agrigento, he makes his way up to the foothills of Mount Etna, heading to Sicily's lemon riviera, and makes a sumptuous lemon risotto in a lemon grove

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo ends his tour of Sicily by learning how to make the sweet treat cannoli and climbing the craters of Mount Etna. He also achieves a personal ambition by visiting the town of Savoca, the setting for Corleone in the Godfather movies - Gino's favourite films of all time. Here, he meets the owners of the bar featured in the film and cooks on the terrace

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo returns to explore more of his native country, this time heading off the beaten track to meet people keeping age-old traditions alive, as well as showcasing the scenery and culture of these lesser-known parts of Italy. He begins in the central state of Abruzzo, learning about chitarra pasta, before heading along the historic Trabocchi coastline to meet a fisherman whose family use a traditional wooden machine for their livelihoods and then travelling into the mountains to meet Mauro, a farmer who also trains the local breed of sheepdog

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo heads to the northern state of Trentino Alto-Adige, which borders both Switzerland and Austria and is home to the Dolomite mountains. The chef meets dairy farmer Graziano, who shows him how to make a local soft cheese, before he moves further into the mountains to learn about the local cured meat known as speck, which is the most important produce to come out of the region. Gino finishes his journey in a picture postcard location where he whips up an apple strudel with a twist

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by actor Jon Hamm, star of Mad Men and Baby Driver, for a yuletide trek around Hong Kong - the most visited and most vertical city on the planet. They join the other 26.7 million tourists, as they gorge themselves on questionable foodstuffs, traditional transportation and the world's largest seated Buddha statue. After resting at the Peninsula Hotel for some colonial opulence, they sample street food and get their fortunes read, before taking to the air for a bird's eye view by helicopter

programme.title: War Factories

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Lindisfarne, which lies off the Northumberland coast. From what became known as the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, monks spread Christianity to the rest of northern England and created one of Britain's finest treasures - the Lindisfarne Gospels. Viking attacks caused the monks to flee but the village survived and today the community has to share it with thousands of tourists

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On a journey from Lucknow in Uttar Pradesh to Kolkata in West Bengal, Michael Portillo charts a course through India's history from the days of The East India Company to the dawn of independence. In Lucknow, he tastes the famous kebabs, stops off at Bodh Gaya, where he meditates on its Buddhist heritage, and In Kolkata, he glimpses colonial Calcutta in the grand Great Eastern Hotel

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In

programme.title: Becoming Elizabeth
programme.desc: It's Christmas at court, and a controversial masque leaves Protestant Edward and Catholic Mary at odds. Elizabeth finds herself in the middle as Mary demands that she come and live with her. The Lord Protector Somerset tries to keep the peace between the siblings

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Golden poison frog Pablo has lost interest in his partner Maria, so 'bad boy' El Loco is brought in to shake things up. In the chimpanzee habitat, there is a power struggle for the role of dominant female, and baby porcupine Marion fends off the meerkat mob

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fun-loving Sonya Smith is the first to host the dinner-party challenge from Reading, Berkshire, and aims to win over the guests with a Touch of Sparkle theme. Aware her cooking skills leave a lot to be desired, she hopes to bungle her way through the night, and though she is amused by the kitchen chaos, not everyone is impressed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Londoner Glen Wilkie hosts the second dinner party of the week in Reading, Berkshire, and is confident of victory. However, a disaster with his dessert gets the day off to a bad start, and his main course, which he has chosen to call Bambi on a Plate, leaves one guest in tears - while another flatly refuses to eat it

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mature student Richard Howse hosts the third dinner party in Reading, using a menu and set of instructions provided by his girlfriend to guide him. A treasure hunt brings out Glen Wilkie's feelings about Serine Daou, Sonya Smith dislikes some of the gluten-free food and, for the third night in a row, Sabi Phagura is served a plate of meat she will not eat

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner party in Reading sees fitness fanatic Sabi Phagura putting her healthy regimen to one side to host a bhangra-themed evening. Unfortunately, neither the traditional Indian food on the table nor the entertainment seems to impress the guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Corset-maker Serine Daou hosts the final night of the culinary competition in Reading, Berkshire, and hopes to impress with her burlesque-themed party. When the gourmet burgers she serves fail to impress, she must rely on the evening's entertainment to put her back on course for the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Trish calls on the help of her friends as she tries to bring light into the interior of her dark mediaeval property. For Bart and Sarah, it is decision time as they visit a château

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Martin and Janette Poole dream of having a home where they can moor their beloved narrowboat at the end of the garden, but are unable to decide whether it should be near their family in Warwickshire or along the Canal du Midi in southern France. Laura Hamilton and Jonnie Irwin help meet the couple's property desires

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple who are torn between two vibrant cities. While Cliff would like to move to Brighton, Sue dreams of living in Montpellier, southern France, where she would like to open a B&B

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Andrew and Shani Hamilton help Sally and Andrew find their dream home in Malaga with a budget of €400,000. In Almeria, Shaun Garner is flying solo as he helps Vishal and his brother Ravi search for a holiday home for the whole family. With a budget of €350,000, big hopes and a small search area, Shaun has little room for manoeuvre

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marlon Williams hosts the first party in Oxford, and hopes his love-island-themed evening will be enough to win him the £1,000 prize at the end of the week. However, after a shambolic start to proceedings, the night ends with the smashing of plates

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Inventor Richard Berrecloth hosts the second dinner party in Oxford, and hopes to impress his guests with home-made food and an unusual form of entertainment. However, Heidi Kelloway and Marlon Williams appear to be more interested in each other than their host's hospitality - while another diner seems rather too keen on sampling the wine

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Victoria Collett hosts the third dinner party in Oxford and begins the day with a hangover and a few culinary disasters. It is not long before her guests start grumbling and Richard Berrecloth criticises her seafood starter, so she pins her hopes on the Caribbean curry being a success

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog trainer James Hearle hosts the fourth dinner party in Oxford, but his four-legged friends threaten to turn the evening into a mess. Tempers also rise between the guests as culinary critic Richard Berrecloth continues shocking the group with his brutal honesty

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Heidi Kelloway hosts the final dinner party in Oxford, determined to lighten the mood of the other diners. However, the evening turns sour when the diners confront the overly critical Richard Berrecloth about his frank comments, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Welsh champion sausage-maker Steve and his wife Helen have travelled the world in search of the perfect holiday home and have decided that Torrox on the Costa del Sol is for them. Scarlette Douglas pulls out all the stops to show five properties within her budget of £95,000

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Liam Charles and Ellie Taylor challenge six new teams to produce 36 perfect Prinsesstårta alongside a chocolate amenity with no recipe to help them. programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George tackles a cottage conundrum, the previous owner has removed all the upstairs walls. He plans to create two more bedrooms and add a bit of privacy. Plus, he meets a couple who have plans to turn their loft into a cinema room

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A night out ends badly when a young man is involved in a fight. A patient who has diabetes collapses with blood sugar levels that the paramedics say are as the highest they've ever seen. Paramedics suspect the barking cough of a toddler is the classic sign of croup, and an intoxicated man with a deep gash to his head needs stitches but first, they need to wrestle a bottle of alcohol from his grasp

Elsewhere, beloved fox red Labrador Jethro has arthritic elbows, which have left him unable to walk properly and are causing him great pain. Noel uses a tiny camera to take a closer look at the joint damage and determine the best course of action

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: A crack team of Britain's top specialist trainers addresses the behaviours of two more troublesome hounds. programme.desc: In the West Midlands, social worker Tutsi serves up a mixture of Zimbabwean and English dishes. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Presenters Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple in their quest for a change of scenery. programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a couple who are currently renting because they have sold their home. While Jeanette is quite certain she would like to settle in Cornwall, Bob has got itchy feet and wants to move to southern Spain

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Mark has a budget of 80,000 euros and is searching for a two-bed apartment close to the coast. In Murcia, Darren and Natalie get creative with their ideas for their company mascot

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Make-up artist Craig Alexander Wilson hosts the first party in Glasgow, hoping his edible glitter and sparklers will impress his fellow diners. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Caroline Wardrope hosts the final dinner party in Glasgow, and throws a 1970s-themed disco evening with a mystery menu. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Steph, who works in recruitment, and Gordon, a recently retired insurance broker, have been married for 33 years. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: An officer is nearly run over by a desperate driver, and another's patience is tested by a drunken motorist. Plus, a law enforcer goes in search of a suspicious character, and a group of youths tries to deceive the interception unit

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A wealthy widow and her daughter are implicated in the death of a hitman out on parole - and it's up to the squad to find out whether the pair hired the victim to kill a rich relative. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.desc: A US marine's parachute fails to open during a training exercise and he plunges to his death, leaving the team to determine whether he was murdered. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A day spent working on a cut-and-dried case leaves the team free to spend some time away from work, and while McGee and Delilah argue over the importance of keeping shop-talk to a minimum, DiNozzo ends up boring his dinner date with crime-solving tales. However, the agents' personal plans are all interrupted as, one-by-one, they realise errors have been made in closing their latest investigation. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Lucifer

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard embarks on a road trip, travelling to Norfolk, Pembroke and Essex. In Pembroke, he finds an old church that has been converted into an antiques store with a varied selection

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In a quiet south London suburb, Drew Pritchard comes face to face with the most extraordinary collection of American automobilia he's ever seen, including Evel Knievel's Messerschmitt

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: The dealers are offered to chance to bid on an art deco cigarette case, a wooden bureau, a china sheepdog by Beswick and a Clarice Cliff preserve bowl. Presented by Nigel Havers

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Serhat Ahmet tour East Anglia hunting for antiques. As their quest continues, Serhat meets the great nephew of a woman who broke the social norms of the day to go to fight on the front line. Catherine, meanwhile, gets to sample a local delicacy that sounds rather unappealing, but has sustained the local population for centuries. The competing duo then head to a picturesque spot by a windmill to watch their items go under the hammer at auction

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers teams up with upcycler Sarah Peterson and lighting expert Duncan McKean to revive a pair of side tables, a rattan chair and some vintage lawnmower buckets

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: A property expert offers advice on buying a second home abroad

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Weighing in at almost 700lbs, 50-year-old Pauline has an addiction to food that is slowly killing her and destroying her son's life as her carer. Can she get back on track?

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A new mother looks for a wedding dress, while another customer wants something daring

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride who hates shopping relies on the support of her friends, and a customer needs to rethink her choice of gown to accommodate her pregnancy

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: The team receives a midnight call-out and discovers hundreds of mistreated animals, including more than 200 birds, dogs and roosters

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: The story of the unpaid volunteers who sacrifice their free time to staff lifeboat stations across the UK. A retired nursery teacher is in danger after trying to rescue her two dogs when they became cut off by the rising tide. In Wales, a volunteer is washed off a cliff after trying to rescue a concussed fisherman, and in Blackpool, three crew members' lives are in jeopardy

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Angus Ashworth and the team are in Harrogate to look through an impressive art deco collection, then hunt for hidden gems at a cottage in Shropshire

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: As their quest for bargains continues, Serhat Ahmet is on the hunt once more for ceramics, while Catherine Southon has her eye on a more eclectic mix of items. Serhat makes some new four-legged friends and finds out about a refugee fleeing his war-torn country who became a local legend in his adopted home town thanks to his crazy stunts and feats of strength. Catherine also gets a taste of a high-speed motorsport and goes for a ride from which she might never recover

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Serhat Ahmet continue their search in Bristol and Gloucestershire, and while Serhat aims for glass and metalware, Christina causes chaos trying to get her hands on possibly the largest Road Trip item ever

programme.title: 1000lb Sisters
programme.desc: Amy is left reeling after giving birth and finding out Michael has Covid-19. Tammy worries she won't pass the final assessments she needs for surgery approval

programme.title: 24 Hour Baby Hospital
programme.desc: Rotunda hospital midwife Mikey, his husband Conleth and midwife Rhona prepare for the birth of their child. The hospital makes plans for the arrival of complex conjoined twins, while single mother Emma prepares for the birth of her first child, with the help of her mother

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin investigate reported sightings of misty figures at Tor House - the one-time Californian home of poet Robinson Jeffers

programme.title: Help! My House Is Haunted
programme.desc: Helen moved into a converted Methodist chapel, but it was soon clear she wasn't the only resident. During investigation, Barri gets hypnotised to find answers

programme.title: Ghost Adventures

programme.title: Salvage Hunters

programme.title: Salvage Hunters

programme.title: The Bidding Room

programme.title: My 600lb Life

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Hayley falls in love with a princess gown that threatens the budget. Plus, real-life princess Nana has her final fitting, but will her mother approve?

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Members of the team rescue a cat trapped in a drain deep underground, and help an abandoned dog in danger of freezing to death

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: Volunteers at one of the RNLI's busiest stations on the River Thames, central London are called in the middle of the night to try and rescue two students, who have jumped naked into the river while high on the drug LSD. On the coast in Newquay, a 12-year-old boy on a cub scout 'coasteering' trip has fallen badly and has suspected spinal damage, while volunteers at Eastbourne lifeboat station recover the body of someone who has taken their own life

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Angus Ashworth heads to Bradford to look through a vast collection of coins, toys and jewellery. Plus, the team clear Yorkshire-made furniture from a beautiful cottage

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Serhat Ahmet and Catherine Southon start the final lap of their antiques race on the bumpy backroads of Lincolnshire, heading to their final destination of Silverstone - the home of the British Grand Prix - in Northamptonshire. On their travels, Catherine discovers the history of the most iconic of classical instruments at a school that teaches students how to make them. Meanwhile, Serhat hears the story of how a group of enterprising 18th-century miners helped turn a peak in Derbyshire into one of the country's earliest tourist attractions

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Serhat Ahmet head to south Wales. There's a mad dash around the shops as Serhat tries to eke out his tiny budget, while Christina struggles to blow all of her money. They look at baths, buckets and big sticks to try to turn a profit at the auction. Serhat follows in the footsteps of two brothers who discovered a whole underground world beneath their farmland, while a trip to a spa doesn't turn out quite as expected for Christina as she takes the plunge into a rather weird and wacky sport

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

However, an old friend of the wizard's, William, accuses Arthur of provoking the situation. With Alexander Siddig and Joe Dempsie

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager

Sci-fi drama, starring Kate Mulgrew and Robert Duncan McNeill, with a guest appearance by Marina Sirtis as Counsellor Deanna Troi

programme.desc: A Londoner is helped in their grief process by an opera singer

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The ever-cheery chef demonstrates the quick and easy way to prepare an impressive takeaway-style meal, comprising lamb shank rogan josh, sesame salt sea bass, noodle-wrapped crisp-fried prawns and srikhand with iced mango shards. He also visits two London restaurants to gain inspiration for preparation and flavourings, sampling plenty of his favourite dishes along the way

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Soho and Milllwall, with fascinating facts for locals and tourists alike. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton crosses the Sea of the Hebrides to explore the Shiants, once owned by Compton Mackenzie, the author of Whisky Galore. He then heads east to the romantic Isle of Ewe, before taking a kayak trip to the Summer Isles, where he samples a seaweed feast, and on to the cliffs of Handa

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits Islay, travelling from Finlaggan - where the famous ruler Somerled once held court - along the windswept coast, through its historic ports and villages to end on its highest mountain. Along the way he joins dedicated locals keeping the seafaring traditions of the island alive, discovers the secrets of Islay's illicit whisky distilling past and climbs Ben Vicar for a breathtaking view across the Hebrides

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: In Pembrokeshire, Kate meets the last master thatcher based in Wales. She also helps with the harvesting of water reeds - an invasive, thick grass-like plant now used on 80 per cent of thatched roofs in the UK. In Pendine Sands, Kate joins a cross-country hunt adapted for modern times and struggles to stay on the horse as they chase hounds who have been specifically trained to only pick up on human scent. Finally, Kate and Teg visit an agricultural college that helps neuro-diverse students thrive through a deep connection with the land

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Munroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Jeffrey (1995)
programme.desc: A gay man living in New York at the height of the Aids epidemic becomes celibate out of fear of catching the disease. When he falls for a man who is HIV positive, he is forced to confront his fears concerning both love and mortality. Comedy drama, starring Steven Weber, Patrick Stewart and Sigourney Weaver

programme.title: Too Late (2015)
programme.desc: A private eye is hired to track down a missing woman with a connection to his own troubled past. The search leads him on a journey through the seedy underworld of Los Angeles, and into a series of encounters with lost souls and eccentric personalities. Detective drama, starring John Hawkes and Jeff Fahey

programme.title: The Iron Rose (1973)
programme.desc: A couple sneak into a cemetery, only to become trapped with the marauding spirits of restless souls. Horror, withng Mireille Dargent and Francoise Pascal, In French

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Munroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures.

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Skysurfer Strike Force
programme.desc: Jack Holister is an extraordinary skydiver who leads a group of vigilante crime fighters known as the Skysurfer Strike Force. who must try to seek out and defeat the robotic Cybron

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: Exploring Hitler's range of bomb and bullet-proof Mercedes cars, which saved his life on numerous occasions

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: In Pembrokeshire, Kate meets the last master thatcher based in Wales. In Pendine Sands, Kate joins a cross-country hunt adapted for modern times and struggles to stay on the horse as they chase hounds who have been specifically trained to only pick up on human scent. programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Camberwell and Mottingham for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: Royals and Animals: Til Death Do Us Part
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the extraordinary relationship between the Windsor's and their animals

programme.title: Tiara Tahiti (1962)
programme.desc: Two chalk-and-cheese British Army officers decide to settle a long-standing grudge in a Tahitian resort during peacetime. Comedy, starring James Mason and John Mills

programme.title: A Kiss Before Dying (1956)
programme.desc: A psychopathic college student is horrified to learn his girlfriend is pregnant, threatening his chances of being accepted into her well-to-do family. In a fit of fury, he murders her and makes it look as if she had committed suicide - only for her sister to show up, taking an uncomfortable degree of interest in the manner of her sibling's death. Thriller, with Robert Wagner, Joanne Woodward, Jeffrey Hunter and Mary Astor

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: In Pembrokeshire, Kate meets the last master thatcher based in Wales. programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: Sheltering from a blizzard in a cave, Monkey tries to trick Pigsy into sacrificing himself to save Tripitaka's life. Cult adventure, starring Masoaki Sakai and Toshiyuki Nishida

programme.title: Aging in the Wild
programme.desc: Documentary revealing what it is like for animals to grow old, looking at longevity, reproductive health, social status, wisdom and eventual death, as well as examining the unique challenges every species face in the ageing process

programme.title: The Informers (1963)
programme.desc: The murder of a Scotland Yard informer starts a trail of deceit and intrigue among London's underworld, prompting a police inspector to conduct his own unorthodox investigation. Thriller, starring Nigel Patrick, Margaret Whiting, Colin Blakely and Derren Nesbitt

programme.title: Dulcima (1971)
programme.desc: A girl treated as a drudge by her family lifts herself from her environment by becoming a housekeeper. Drama, starring John Mills, Carol White and Stuart Wilson

programme.title: The Maids (1975)
programme.desc: Two maids hate their employer, so whenever they are alone in the house, they indulge in a sexual roleplay fantasy in which they take turns dressing up as her, so the other can pretend to murder her. Drama based on Jean Genet's stage play, starring Glenda Jackson and Susannah York

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman invite more famous faces to take part in the general knowledge quiz. This time, stars from the world of soaps - both past and present - are challenged to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Former EastEnders Joe Swash (Micky Miller) and John Altman (Nick Cotton) join forces, veteran Hollyoaks actor Nick Pickard (Tony Hutchinson) teams up with old co-star Ali Bastian (Becca Dean), Waterloo Road secretary Victoria Bush (Sonya Donnegan) partners former student Zaraah Abrahams (Michaela White) and Holby City nurse Tina Hobley (Chrissie Williams) reunites with her on-screen mother Sharon Maughan (Tricia Williams)
